text: Not sure what all of the fuss is about. Overpriced foods that I can make at home. The only thing I would actually pay for again is the green smoothie. Oh and the jicama fries are terrible.

I really love the food and juices here but there is always a problem. Today I called in an order 10 minutes before I arrived and came in and paid. I waited about 30 minutes inside before I asked someone about my order. They brought it out and said they forgot to bring it out and it was cold. THEN I looked inside and everything I ordered was wrong. It gets better. They then brought out my new order which was also wrong. So I've been waiting 45 minutes for 1 turkey burger and I'm quite disappointed
Unique blend of healthy and tasty all in one location.  Try it... You'll like it!
First time trying out this place ordered a breakfast burrito but I never had a burrito come in all wet and how are you suppose to hold and eat when it's all wet? Little disappointed.

If your a 110 lbs women or not very hungry this might be the place for you , if you don't mind paying $12 for a sub mediocre salad leaving hungry ,this might be the place for you as well .  I'm not either .  I went there after working out and I was starving, i figured I'd have a nice healthy salad. I ordered the large Albacore Salad , the guy at the front said it was good ,  when I opened it I almost peed my pants , it was 5 pieces of bibb lettuce , 2 cherry tomato's , a scoop of canned tuna and Dijon mustard (not mustard dressing) this was the large too , 
Generally I like to go to a place more then once to give an open minded review, but I'm not sure if I could bring myself back to give it another chance. The Daily Wellness is a much better place !
Glad to c another restaurant with some raw food options.  Would be nice if they had some fresh pressed green juices and some raw salad options.
Great healthy  food. I usually go after my morning  workout.  Friendly staff , clean tables, TV

They have some of my favorites- the greek scramble is my absolute favorite breakfast item on Earth. I also get the low-carb caesar salad on the regular! However I recently had the 7 cheese vegetable broccoli soup and I was pretty disappointed. It was extremely bland. So food-wise, I would say they are kind of hit and miss.

The staff are always very kind and polite. They get busy in the afternoon, so I usually place an order on the phone and then pick it up to avoid the wait.
Enjoyed breakfast here with a Groupon. I had a smoothie and the breakfast burrito - both were delish, and the tofu fries were too!  It is pricey though!
First time coming here and we fell in love with this place,their Bison wrap is the best,this is our new favorite for healthy food!!!

I love the wellness drink! The owner has been studying nutrition for years and really plans everything in the menu with the best possible nutrients.  Everything is amazingly fresh down to the cucumber lemon water.  I can not wait until they start catering!

So far, I have only come in here for breakfast, but I have loved everything I'ved tried! This place is right by the gym so the location is very convenient. I've gotten the oatmeal with bananas, cinnamon, raisins. The mulitgrain protein pancakes and granola french toast have to be my favorites. I loved the turkey sausage and egg whites. The portions are pretty big, which I like because I can share with someone or take the rest home. I love the Berry Blast smoothie which is nice when I'm on the go and can't sit down to eat. I can stop in and just grab a smoothie. I have been here quite a few times and I notice that sometimes the food can take about 15-20 minutes to come out, even when I only have one entree for myself. Other than that, the staff is very nice, the place is clean, and the food is tasty!

One of my favorite health food places in Vegas real food real tasty!! The ostrich patty is excellent and the smoothies are delicious especially the "wellness" drink. Pricey but most healthy places seems to be.

The Bison burger is delicious. The chicken quinoa salad was cool, fresh and tasty. Add avocado to everything because it's yummy. Add banana to the watermelon strawberry smoothie to make it a little creamier. The place is well decorated for a good atmosphere and well maintained. Bathrooms are clean too. Would love to have one of these in California.

Not a juice bar. They do not serve juices. What they do serve is smoothies. All drinks are blended and contain fiber. That is not a juice. If you want fresh cold pressed juice I suggest you try one of the many other legitimate juice bars in the area.

This is one of my favorites. I usually get the bbq chicken pizza on lavash. It tastes great and is low calorie. Service is always good despite having to wait in line sometimes (that means that it is good). My only complaint is that their wraps and burgers come with a choice of tofu fries or jicama fries as a side. I am not a fan of either and think sweet potato fries would be a great alternative.

If you are looking for a place with fresh eats and yummy shakes, this is it.  I really liked it, it seems unique and has really great "healthy" food.  Located near LVAC, it attracts that healthier, fit crowd; but I went for the shakes.  I do try to watch what I eat, and this place does not offer greasy and heavy food.  It's fresh and well proportioned.  Friendly, inshape (lol) staff and patrons as well.

We have been here twice now, and still not impressed.

The customer service and staff are excellent, which is why I gave them two stars.
However, I have not had anything there that I liked yet. I am a huge smoothie fan, but there's aren't up to par. Have had much better in this area of town.

Some of their drinks are an acquired taste, but it's fun to be adventurous in the name of "good for you." Food items haven't failed me yet. Only downer is the prices are slightly higher than seems fair.

Healthy and tasty, free wifi, and great customer service, too.

This is definitely one of my favorite health food places in Vegas! I'm really big in to health and fitness, and this place definitely meets the needs of health freaks, while also giving some more indulgent options as well. No matter what I always order the Wellness Drink every time I go. SO AMAZING and packed with fresh delicious ingredients. If you're a green juice person, this is the drink for you! I also usually always order their barbecue chicken pizza. The crust is amazing, the thin crust and the gluten free, I've had both, and the sauce and flavor is just incredible and the pizza only has 320 cals! How awesome. I have also had one of their wraps, forget the name but it's packed with a ton of vegetables and comes with tofu fries. So delicious, except I would say that the asparagus in the wrap was just a little too crunchy for me and kind of threw off the texture of the rest of it. I also have been to the Henderson location many times, and I must say this location just does it was better! The shape of their pizza is better and the taste of their smoothie was amazing.. but overall.. LOVEEE greens and proteins! definitely go if you have the chance! you won't regret it!!

After about a dozen orders, mostly carryouts, the service and quality have declined steadily. My first several visits easily merited five stars. However, the always cheerful welcome has been gone for a while, and tonight's carryout meal was a disappointment. The salmon was good, but the avocado portion was small and so full of brown spots that I wouldn't eat it. The watery mashed sweet potatoes were not tasty. Furthermore, the cashier closed the cash drawer with a hasty thanks and goodbye but without the change I was due. Until I see a string of favorable reviews I'm taking my smoothie business to the nearby smoothie restaurant, and my healthy meal business to the nearby protein restaurant. I'll be back at some point, with the hope of providing a more positive review.

I must say I am not the healthiest person buuuut I finally got the chance to go in and check out this place that many of my co-workers would speak of. I had the bison burger and it's by far my all time favorite burger!! Everything is fresh and the meat is just perfect. I also enjoy the wellness green juice. Every now and then I call and schedule it to pick up. The guy that's usually there is a young man named Raul that always takes good care of us and makes sure that our food and juices are top notch. Excellent customer service by him and the rest of the greens and proteins team. By the way get the sweet potatoes fries!!!! You go g&p!

The best I can say is that the food was edible. That's the good part. 

The place caters to paleo and vegan type people, so it's going to be more expensive, but it substantially so. They are a food and smoothie shop with an open kitchen, but do not have enclosed blenders, so there is a huge amount of noise. Also, they do not appear to have run cycles on the blenders, so someone will turn one on, and walk away to do something else, and leave it running. One was left going for 5 minutes non stop. 

The food: to say that it was worth it would be an overstatement. One entree was the shrimp, cous cous and asparagus. For 13 dollars, there were literally 5 shrimp. My cheese steak was greasy to a level that was borderline inedible (It's a cheese steak, so that's par for the course.) The jicama fries tasted like nothing and overall everything was bland and boring.  The food had all of the outward appearances of a place that isn't trying all that hard.  

You can get some veggies and protein there that's about as interesting as a subway salad.

While this place is fine and technically proficient, I was not wowed or amazed by my meal, and for the price, I would not come back here again.  I did the make your own meal where you pick a protein, a "green", a "grain" and a sauce.  The chicken was done well and was juicy, the quinoa was a bit on the al dente side for me, but again was fine, and avocado is avocado.  What I did not care for was how they served it.  It was on a large plate, with everything separate and not touching.  I felt like someone who had OCD fixed the plate.  I would've preferred a bowl where I could mix the things together with the sauce, since quinoa isn't exactly easy to get on a fork with chicken and avocado already on it.  Quinoa is also rather bland by itself.

I also got the Thai Ginger soup, which was more like a thick yellow curry with nothing in it.  I love ginger, and couldn't really taste it in this soup, which was disappointing to me, as it's the reason I ordered it.

I would honestly give this place 2.5 stars, more on the lines of "meh" than A-ok, and that's mainly because the service here was decent and the people working behind the counter were nice and helpful.  I would honestly rather go to the Sweet Tomatoes down the street as it's about the same cost depending on what you order.

I am currently a vegan and thought this place would be a great place to grab a healthy 'juice'. So I come here with my dad and he orders a parfait and I order a green 'juice' and the total comes to about $16 dollars with tip. I thought that was a tad on the expensive side but I know the prices of juice are very expensive because of the amount of vegetables and fruits that go into a juice (I worked at a juice bar for about two years so I understand juice pricing). So my 'juice' comes out and it's a smoothie? I do not know how they can call these smoothies juices?! It was frozen and it was really sweet for something that was considered a green juice. I was very disappointed and felt very mislead. My dad did not like his parfait either (too sugary). As a health nut and a biochemist I would not consider this place to be healthy at all. Albeit I have not tried any other items but i will assure you that I will not be coming back to try anything else. The only time that any one should go sugar load there is after a very High intensity work out. The only reason I have this place two stars is because the service was lovely. 

A note for the greens and proteins owners: 
I would recommend rewording the menu so it is not so misleading. I know you mean well and have a great idea but for people educated on health and wellness it is very misleading.

I stopped at the one on Flamingo for the first time yesterday and took forever to decide what I wanted.  I asked the gal at the counter for suggestions and one of hers was the summer salad.  I ordered a small one with chicken and it was absolutely delicious and very large portion.  I will definitely come back.
It was good my sandwich was tasty and healthy. My wife's gluten free pizza with Low fat cheese was also tasty.

Not bad.  Been here twice on a Groupon.  The first time the sausage was grotesquely cold, but they took care of it.  Didn't care for the greek scramble or the scrambled egg whites with housemade [cold] turkey sausage.  The berry parfait and Greens & Proteins Breakfast Burrito are good.  The Green Leaf Berry Blast was yummy and not too sweet, just super spendy after the tip. Won't go out of my way to return.

Found them through Groupon. 

It's about 5 miles from the Strip but boy is it worth it!

My husband and I both ordered the southwest tofu and soyrizo burrito. Mind you my husband is a full on beefaterian, while I'm a vegetarian. It came with house salsa (amazing), and tofu house fries (bombtastic). The burrito had the right amount of heat but not too overwhelming. I also ordered a strawberry watermelon shake, it was so refreshing. They also offer complimentary cucumber lemon water, we couldn't get enough!

They offer a breakfast and lunch menu. They also have different types of proteins, such as bison and ostrich meat. Another reason to come here is their juices and shakes! 

A must try!

I would like to thank the wonderful staff at G&P! I have been coming to this location for the last couple of months and today they were even more amazing than ever!

I ordered my normal breakfast to be picked up on my way into the office this morning. Well...that pickup turned into a cancel because I drove right by the exit, yup I didn't even think about exiting (I guess my autopilot kicked in ha!) 

I went ahead and called over to give them the courtesy call that I would not be able to make it and they can do what they please with the food. Becca (I believe her name was) answered the phone and had her supervisor jump on the line. 

Priscilla assured me that it was alright and that they would re-make it when I could come by later in the day, all I needed was to give them a 10-15 minute window. Sure enough, when I called Priscilla answered and she knew right away and said it was no problem and that they would have it ready. I was elated!

I know this a bit lengthy, but I would like to express my gratitude to G&P staff! Thank you, thank you, thank you! Superb customer service and always delicious food!

1.5 star for today. Patrick so unfriendly during my encounter with him while his processing my transaction. It's a first time I got treated like this here. He's tall and I think he's of the manager. He better change that attitude or else customer like me will be so disappointed and stop coming back to this location.

Clean, bright, and nice. I will return to enjoy the healthy variety. You can chose from many of the menu protein drinks or create your own. This restaurant is a great place to eat that won't give you indigestion or undermine good health.
Tons of options The food actually tasted like food, which is a lot more than I can say for Rachel's Kitchen. Also the green drink is good, looks weird though

Greens and Proteins provided a meal for our crew and cast of 70 on a short film last week.  Our shoot was hard to say the least, it was so hot at least for those of us not from Vegas and we were shooting nights.  Green and Proteins came in and made everything a whole lot better.  So often on set we have the same old meals, over salted and too heavy.  Greens and Proteins gave us plenty of fresh and wholesome food that tasted fabulous and got us through the rest of the night.  I can not recommend them highly enough for you catering needs.  I am a big fan :)

If you go get the chicken, asparagus and sweet potato mash it was my first time and I feel great! And Marc was great and very helpful. He gave suggestions and checked back to see how we were doing it was like a sit down restaurant with a less formal feel!

Vegan is hard to do. They did it!

Got the veggie burger with seasoned tofu fries. GF got the Cali Chicken wrap. Pumpkin spice tea and Chocolate veggieccino.

I've been here many times, but I usually get the wellness drink which is delicious, but a bit pricey. 

I finally tried food. Turkey Burger with Jimica(?) fries.. I was not a fan of those fries they are served cold and the texture reminded me of an apple. 

I went again today and hap the BBQ Chicken pizza and wow! So good. SOOOO GOOD! I want another one! Lol 

I also really like the atmosphere since I am usually finishing a run or workout when I visit I don't always look my best. The staff is always friendly. And there's always others in workout clothes too. I don't feel out of place here. Also an okay place to visit solo

Hearing so many great things about this place, I decided to check it out for myself. I've never left a bad review in my life until now.  Although the food was great I could only give one star because their staff was terrible.  Being in the service industry, I am really big on customer service.  It took forever for the cashier to acknowledge me because she and another staff member were texting and talking on their cell phones.  Very unprofessional, poor customer service, unfriendly.  I will probably eat there again only because I was pleased with the food, but some of the staff members could use a course or two on customer service.
Great healthy food, has so many GF options and different chains. However it is pretty pricey and a long wait time
Love the margharita pizza here!! Will try more dishes next time I go! Maybe after the gym, lol.

VERY accommodating. Great customer service! I had a VERY unusual request during today's lunch visit. I had just had my teeth professionally whitened and was told I could not eat any foods or beverages with color, what so ever. Only white or clear foods would be allowed for the next 48 hours. I expressed this "odd situation" when it was my turn to order. Next thing I knew Mark (the cashier at the time) and I had concocted an egg white with feta cheese omelet and a side of straight up, plain Jane jicama fries. Though it may not have been the most delicious culinary outtake you have ever heard of, it was a creative and accommodating dish that served up well in my time of need. And it tasted pretty good in the big scheme of things. Thank you again for the great attitude and customer service experience it required to solve my colorless food dilemma.

really love this place. they have great juices and really awesome options for everyone from the raw diet to the meat diet. Had 1 bad experience here when I ordered a gluten free pizza and they brought me one that was not gluten free and only caught it after I had eaten a slice. The waiter just blew it off as an "oops" but for me it is an intolerance not a diet choice so it was not a little "oops" to me. I was a bit taken aback by his flippancy. I didn't make a huge thing about it, maybe i should have but i was just disappointed. If you are celiac definitely double and triple check everything...Other than that, i have never had a bad meal there. It is a favorite post yoga and post airport treat

I will never eat here again! The cheese and broccoli soup was very running and hand little flavor. The hummus was worst very bland and no flavor. It tasted like an old rag. The cost was pricy. I get that you are paying for health but it would be far cheaper to buy some chicken , brown rice, and kale, put nothing on it and cook it! This is a fad but an expensive one!

I was really excited to try this place!  Just moved to LV and was looking for some healthy dining experiences.  Me and a friend both ordered the bison burger in a lettuce wrap with tofu fries and I also ordered a Green Ginger limeaid.  The green drink showed up quick and was sooooo good!  A+ and about 10ish minutes later our food arrived....The burgers had the bun on them instead of the lettuce wrap but the waiter was really great and brought the lettuce out promptly!  The burger was delicious!  There was some sort of yummy sauce that came with it too.  The tofu fries were ok...they weren't hot :(  probably would have been great if they were hot, but I ate them anyways bc they were still good.  Next time I will order the jicama fries.  Cant wait to come back to G & P and try everything else out!

Delicious!!! Perfect spot to get a healthy meal after working out at LVAC. Their juices and smoothies are great and I love their breakfast. A bit overpriced thus the minus one star but other than that my new favorite breakfast spot!
Awesome concept. Very friendly and efficient staff. Very fresh, healthy and proportioned menu with lots of choices for all diets.

First experience and last. Most painful order experience. I asked what the restaurant was about. The girl couldn't and answer me just stared blankly. I asked her what the * meant next to lean angus burger and she had no idea what I was taking about. I should have turned and walked out and gone to the other protein place across the parking lot. I then asked about the Salads and then portion size. I made sizes with my hands. Again a blank stare. It was pulling teeth to get anything out of her. I will never go back again because of that experience. She was clueless, lazy, and did not want to work. I'm in sales and I work for my money. I expect others to as well.

My partner & I are from out of town & we both watch what we eat. This place is AHMAZING due to the fact that they have the amount of protein, fats & carbs per menu item written alongside the descriptions! It's a dream come true for people who log their food in diet apps such as MyFitnessPal. I wish we could get a place like this in Australia :(

We didn't have ANY issues with the speed of the service or the quality of the food. Very very bloody delicious

I've been here a couple of times, and the service is always friendly! I have a ridiculous amount of food allergies to watch for, and they're always willing to check labels for me or answer any questions. I like the build your own meal option, but it can be a little pricey depending on what you order. Usually, I order the Angus burger wrapped in lettuce with vegan cheese. Comes out to about $12 with tax, which is reasonable considering the quality of the beef. Also, I love being able to use those substitutes!! The only bummer is the sides they have to choose from ..no soy allowed, so I can't  have tofu fries, and the jicama fries taste like raw potato to me.  Only other option is a vegetable, but honestly? Broccoli with a burger isn't the best. Still giving them a good rating because of the staff, though. Keep it up guys!!
Best healthy fast food in Vegas! I only wish there was one by my work so I could have if for every meal!!
I Love Greens and Proteins. The wellness drink is the best! Everything is so good and super healthy for you. Great place to hit after the gym!

This is just on the basis of the madness of how they made an $8 smoothie: they added a heap of ice, which, you know is basically just filler. Then they ended up making too much, filled my cup and dumped the extra --- all of those wonderful fruits and vegetables --- down the sink. So frustrating to pay nearly ten bucks for some diluted smoothie, the rest of which is wasted, flowing down the drain.
Just ate breakfast. Burrito was pretty good but asked for a side of fruit and they gave me literally the smallest side of fruit. Not even enough for a kid. Guess times are tough.

Quick and healthy! My kind of place.
So far I liked everything I've ordered.
Favorite thing on the menu- Bison on spinach wrap.
Super healthy, super yummy!

Easy order, easy pick up on the way to work or football practice.

Im updating to 5 stars because they have added to the menu and in all the times I have been there (alot) they have not disappointed. Kudos here. And they just opened a new location at Rainbow & 215, which is great for me. 

I love this place, the food is great for healthy living. Quality is great and ppl are nice, the owner does his best for his customers. I am absolutely addicted to the wellness drink. The reason i didnt give it 5 stars is because its a lil pricey for what you get and i wish they had more variety on the menu and daily specials. Perhaps they could use an executive chef that puts a bit more flavor in the mix.
Very vegan friendly! Whole foods! Clean eating! Healthy! Raw options. Great service. Great food.

great vegan breakfast burrito.  great juices.  I used a groupon here.  Lady at register was very friendly.  I enjoy these style restaurants more than traditional sit down.  Pay up front and they still bring it to you.  little bit pricey but worth it.
I'm trying to eat & they are painting the restaurant during dining hours! Nothing like the fumes & scent of paint in a health food restaurant.
Breakfast, lunch and dinner are served here. Each of these meals are healthy, clean, and tasty. The prices are not cheap but definitely worth it.

WOW......this place has an incredible menu !   Unique items not found anywhere else!    A little on the pricey side, but not when you realize how healthy the eats are !  I decided it was well worth the money !  I am now totally addicted to their ginger lime-aid -- like nothing I have ever had !!!   Totally addicted for good !
Tasty food and great customer service from all the crew! This will be my go to spot for lunch now
Love G&P-they offer so many choices, they have great juices! The food is full service quality at fast casual prices!! They even have spaghetti squash!! Love the #vegan options!

This place is definitely not my favorite & the prices are a bit on the high side for the amount of food you get. Taste wasn't exceptional either but the smoothie was delish, although at almost $8, I'll just make my own food & make my own smoothie. Thanks but no thanks.

I admit I've probably driven past this place a billion times but finally paid attention to it when I was on Groupon and saw they had a $12 for $6 deal and had to try it. Came in during lunch time and it wasn't too busy. I was told I had to make sure I spent at least $12 for the Groupon deal so I went ahead and ordered an Acai Smoothie which wasn't amazing compared to other Acai smoothies I've ordered but still drink worthy. For a meal I ordered the Turkey Burger with Jicama Fries as I've never had Jicama before and well, the turkey burger was excellent but Jicama, I am NOT a fan of you and should have gone with the Tofu instead. There was a little bit of a wait especially in between my smoothie and meal, like I literally was almost done with my smoothie by the time my food was ready but all staff members had a smile on their face, very friendly and even with some slow service I still got in and out of there in a decent amount of time during the lunch hour. I'll definitely be back to try more especially as they serve healthy menu items for a fair price compared to others!
Hard to find a good spot for healthy food in this part of Vegas. Everything was very fresh. Great smoothie / juice bar. Excellent staff! Went 3x in a 2 day span after finding it.
Eating while on the go in just a nightmare that I try to avoid. Eating at Greens and Proteins however is a breeze! I don't struggle to find food that won't hurt me and tastes delicious.

Came here one day for lunch with a friend (actually come to think of it, it was before the Brooklyn Bowl event) XD 

Margherita Pizza (Low-fat mozzarella, tomatoes, roasted garlic, and basil) - To my surprise, i didn't know there was roasted garlic in this. If anything, all i noticed was the huge amount of mozzarella cheese on the pizza. They have different crusts you can pick. thin pizza crust (normal), lavash (a persian? flat bread?), and something else. Not sure what lavash was or the other one (and this was my friends pizza anyway but i was ordering/paying) so i decided to get the normal thin pizza crust. Flavor overall, like a normal margherita pizza. Only thing was i hope they can amp up the roasted garlic flavor (or maybe i can request for more/additional roasted garlic... XD garlic lover om nom nom) and the crust, maybe they can bake it longer. It was a little soft for my taste. The edge crust, it was nice and crispy, but anything under the toppings, was a little, floppy =X

Bison Cheese Steak Wrap (Red onions, peppers, low-fat mozzarella, lettuce, and tomato) - this order was for me. I thought it was quite interesting and ive never had bison before. something new to try for me. Comes with either a side of tofu fries or jicama fries and a pickle. The pickle was a normal pickle spear (yum). I opted for the tofu fries (curious but definitely not a stranger to tofu). Nicely fried. A little underseasoned but still tasted yummy (i like tofu anyway). As for the wrap, you get a choice of either a savoy cabbage wrap, wheat wrap, spinach wrap, or whole wheat bun. I opted for the spinach wrap. Overall, it looked decent and yummy. While i ate it, it was dripping a lot of juices/oil. Almost made it seem like this wrap was heavier/fattier than it really was. First experience in trying bison? uhm if i wasnt told it was bison, id almost call it beef. Overall, flavored well but a bit messy to eat (drippy drippy ....) Im not sure how healthy this wrap was but after eating it, i didnt feel so healthy. LOL  

Overall, nice place. A bit on the pricey side. These two items added up to i believe around $24? I guess a price to pay for fresh/organic? ingredients. May try other things next time since i think i picked the fattiest item on the menu.

I am somewhat of a fitness enthusiast so I was looking for a place that sold healthy food and drinks. I came across Greens and Proteins while driving along eastern avenue. Now I'm used to cooking and making my own healthy greens and protein foods, so I have a bit higher standard for places like this. First of all, they are relatively expensive but this is understandable considering the healthy ingredients which tend to be natural or organic. 

My friend ordered one of the actual meals while I ordered one of the green drinks, I believe it was the one with chocolate flavor. Anyways, my drink tasted horrible. Maybe it was too healthy but I couldn't swallow it. If you are into this type of thing, maybe its for you. My friend ordered something I believe with the eggs and it was ok.

The environment is very nice. When we went the place was booming so I have no complaints there. The staff is friendly and it gives off a healthy, clean, fitness vibe. I think you just have to be into this type of food. It's a different taste which I don't like but many health buffs will like. Maybe I will try a different food so I shouldn't jump to conclusions. I will update this review once I try something different and will take pictures of what I ordered.

"Healthy Food" is such a trend so I feel most places just make anything healthy and it'll be popular. The food is very bland, the hummus is horrible. So dry and flavorless please avoid. The chicken satay is yummy "the peanut sauce" on it is healthy and good. As for everything else I don't think healthy has to mean lacking flavor, and spice. This place is alright wouldn't recommend anyone to come here.

Where can I start?  We used to live in Vegas and our BIGGEST complaint over that 3 year period was always the same thing... There are 0 healthy/organic/clean food options in Vegas off the strip!  So, as it goes, within 1 month of moving back to Miami, G&P opens their first location, lol.  
1.  BOTH locations are super clean, great seatin in&outside
2.  Breakfast options at all good, healthy but not boring
3. Lunch options are just as awesome, the quality of their products shines through in all their dishes. Very unique! 
4.  Lastly is the star of the show... The JUICES!! OMG! Seriously, I'm not even a juice guy, but they make them so different and enjoyable, you don't even know it's healthy.  The wellness that everyone raves about is all that.... 7 or 8 diff green fruits & leafy's with a touch of agave and your Good to go!

Way to go G&P!  You hit the nail on the head.  Keep it up!
great food, great smoothies, I would also recommend breakfast there...tofu served like country potatoes is quite taste.  Only does side would be the prices. $$$

So seriously, why is everyone so obsessed with this place? I get it's healthy and nutritious, blah blah but it's overpriced and the food itself is just meh. But maybe I'm the one with weird taste bc I do enjoy me some Protein House and I get sad that Protein House is only in Henderson. 

I've tried different things at Greens from their juices, to the burgers, to the fake pizza, spaghetti squash, and everything was simply not memorable. The only good thing, that I actually enjoy eating, is probably the tofu fries. Those deserve 4 stars.
Friendly service and great options. Food wasn't fantastic, I built my own and husband got the bison wrap. The sweet potato fries were the star, we are hoping to try other items next time.

Service awful. Young muscle head cashier never said hello, never smiled, never thanked me after tipping him cash. He served me my ostrich burger it is was dried out completely and the sweet potato fries were stone cold. Took forever to get it in the first place. Not even busy. Just think they were lazy and not really paying attention. Will never eat here again. It used to be much better when it first opened up several years ago. Now it just sucks! They could do without the attitude for sure!

First time at this location. The dining area seems a lot more spacious and clean than the location on 215/eastern. There was only one couple that ordered ahead of us (and maybe only one other group of people who already had food) in the restaurant. The food took ~20 minutes to come out! I NEVER waited that long at the other location and it was much busier. The food was really good but wait time ruined it, might as well go to a full service restaurant. The build your own meal is the way to go, the sauce options are awesome - especially the pesto! It is pricey but "healthier" than most.

I go in here specifically for MANBAKE bars which are so so good! I love the double chocolate and cookie dough! They have a bunch of flavors right at the register when you walk in. Make sure you check the expiration date because they are all different ;)

The atmosphere is like a cafe sit down area with open windows. Choose between a large selection of healthy breakast items , lunch or dinner. I went at breakfast loved the greek scramble, a bit bummed on just black coffee no creamer or substitute for creamer but they have a nice selection of special caffeine and non caffeine drinks. My husband got the burrito and enjoyed it with a peanut butter bananna smoothie shocker he couldent taste the kale or spinach in it thats a bonus for him. My daughter enjoyed a turkey burger. Overall great food will definitely be back.
Amazing place to come for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. I love their menu and fast service.
Very fresh, great menu selection and variety. A little pricey but worth it. Good customer service.

Concept is good, quality is good, but not good enough to give more stars. Particularly for the price I would expect something better.

To be fair, I only tried their smoothies, so I might have a different opinion when I have other items.

Review 6/4/17: This used to be my go-to establishment for smoothies. I'll chalk today up to short-staffed. They're now adding ice to the smoothies ... I don't remember them doing this before. The drink was watery with chunks of ice left in. The person taking our orders totally blew it with one ... leaving out the peanuts and honey. I'll go back, but be more careful about ordering.

Review 11/4/17: We've tried a few more times since my last review (which somehow never got posted). They've changed menus several times (with price increases accordingly). Today we ordered 2 more smoothies specifying "no ice" and "no honey". They were both so sicky-sweet we had to trash them after a few sips. Apparently (and confirmed by the server), the sugar comes from the "chocolate chips). Really? They used to include Stevia, honey, and the banana as the sugar sources. My conclusion is they switched to a cheaper sweetened chocolate. Sigh! Another establishment starts up with ideals and slips into mediocrity as economic reality sets in (I'm giving the benefit of the doubt that profit margins are not the drivers here).

Today is Monday, March 21, 2016 and I have NEVER left a yelp review positive or NEGATIVE however, the chain events that I went through at this one Greens and Proteins I felt compelled to. I called from the parking lot, using my bluetooth, to place a to-go order, I was at the Lifetime fitness on Charleston and just finished my workout (11:45 am). Immediately I was asked if it was okay to put me on a brief hold. I was on hold for over 10 minutes, and by the time they picked up again I was standing right in front of the cashier. She seem annoyed at ME, which is ridiculous because it should be the other way around, and she said, "our phones are not working properly." I placed my tuna salad and chicken quinoa salad and the cashier said in a condescending tone, "well at least you do not have to wait long for your order because you are ordering salads." $19.00 + dollars and on top of it I tipped them 2.00 (which I should have not had I known what other crap I had to endure). Had it not been for the Seven magazine I was reading to occupy my time, I realized 15 minutes had passed and those who ordered after me were already eating or have left. I looked into the kitchen and the two cashiers were talking and "looking busy." I see my salad order just sitting on the counter in the kitchen. I loudly say, "Is that my salad order I have been waiting for?" They looked at me as if I am the one being rude and look at the order like it appeared there magically. Since my husband had already had lunch he said he would eat the quinoa salad for dinner. I just got a call from him at 7:30 pm and he said there was GLASS in his salad. I called to inform this location what we had been through. Of course it is not the evening shifts fault and Priscilla, the supervisor I spoke to apologized and offered to buy us new meals but that is not what I want because I am NEVER going to this place again. The Greens and Proteins on Rainbow is closer to me and I usually go there. This was my second and LAST time going to the Flamingo location. If you decide to patronize this venue, be aware and cautious.

This my jam.

This is one of my favorite spots in my area. 

The juices are awesome and creative. They taste great. They aren't cheap (7 bucks or so), but at least you get fresh ingredients. That's what counts right?

Food is quite good too. The Bison cheesesteak is delicious. So are all of the flatbreads.

Most Vegas locals know about this spot, but if you are unfamiliar, give it a shot!

I've been here a few times. The first time I found something on my burger and when I told the manager he took care of me. I appreciated the good customer service. Their pizza is good and so is the angus burger. Smoothies are healthy and a nice size, but overall the food is expensive. I'm ok with paying for good quality if the ingredients are healthy, just can't come here too often. I appreciate them showing the calorie count!!

Always clean restaurant and their food is amazing! A lot of different options and everything I have tried is good! Their staff is friendly as well and there is tons of seating! The bison cheesesteak wrap with sweet potato fries is my fave!

I always love Greens and Proteins except for the times, like today, when I am missing half of my order (ordered through Postmates so I couldn't check myself). I wouldn't mind if it was cheaper food, but for the fact that this is more expensive than other options and to still not receive what I ordered is annoying and I paid for something I didn't receive. Just some advice for Greens and Proteins, double check orders before checkout so someone isn't leaving a bad yelp review.

Visited on Aug.20 at 7:45pm. I've been a customer for 3 yrs & never before had a negative experience however last night was a disappointment! I have laryngitis otherwise I would have requested a do over in the store. The lady that took my order for a green ginger limeade was wearing plastic gloves that she handled my money with. I then witnessed her sweeping the floor with the same gloves on & then delivering a meal with the same gloves. That customer sent his meal back for more rice. She made my drink with the same gloves on & I think she was having a rough night as my drink was devoid of any ginger or lime & was watered down. Just as I got my drink another customer came back in to complain & have their green ginger limeade remade as it was waterey. Please have your employees change their gloves as the above is very unhygienic. I should have also asked for a redo on my drink.

Food here is good the buffalo chicken pizza and the bison philly are my two favorites. I really don't need to explain why this place is soooo good just go and try for your self you won't be disappointed. But seriously the bison Philly was almost if not just as good as a Philadelphia Philly
Gluten free friendly Great place to eat healthy.  The staff is friendly! It's a clean place bonus for me. You can sit outside as well.
Great place to get an after workout juice or smoothie!  You all are fabulous!

Love this place! Been looking for a new spot to eat healthy at and I found it. Ir had the create your own with chicken, brown rice, broccoli ad get the lemon vinaigrette dressing and put it all over everything. Love that dressing, seriously wish they would bottle it and let me take it home! I've also had the veggie pizza and chef salad here too which are both really good and light. All in all this place is phenomenal and all the staff are really nice!

Greens and proteins is a decent restaurant with healthy offerings but at the end of the day, there's not enough offerings and variety for us to be regulars.  

I ordered the angus burger with lettuce pocket (instead of bun) with tofu fries.  Angus burger was fine, not salty which is good.  The tofu fries were salty because of the seasoning.  So healthwise, its kind of a wash with the tofu fries lol.

My wife ordered the build your own with angus patty, kale, and sweet potato mash.  She seemed to enjoy it because the kale was steamed and not sodium bombed.  She also ordered a ginger limeade which was too sweet for her taste.

The price was surprisingly high as all the above came out to 35 bucks (with tip).  So although we feel the food is relatively healthy, the price and distance from our home is a small obstacle for consistent repeat business..

The cool thing about this location is that is open till 10pm for all those healthy late snack meals.

They have bison burgers, and other cool healthy foods. 

The place is open and has outdoor seating. 

They can accommodate any meal plan and if you call ahead they can have it waiting for you. 

All the cool vibe of a hip food restaurant without the guilt.

THis has been on my list for a while but rarely do I get to this side of town. I liked it! I'll be back, let's break it down

Atmosphere: Clean, well lighted,,, I felt healthy walking in. Smells fresh.  Basic seating set up.  I went at 11:30 Saturday and it was not too crowded,, people there but not too much.

Food: That's what you're here for right? The best description again is,,, clean.  Seems to me that it's all natural organic type food.  I've had burgers, Avocado/Crab cups, and some of the drinks.  Burgers are surprisingly juicy, and I'm looking to try some of the salads next time.

Drink: Note the smoothies are like a meal so you probably don't want that AND a full meal unless you are splitting.   The juices are all very nice and clean.  Favourite is the Wellness drink.

Price: For what it is,,  a little expensive,, a juice and any meal will be twenty.  One of the other Yelpers claimed it was the Whole Foods of restaurants and I think its a great comparison.

Miscellaneous: One of the few places I can think of that put calorie counts.

I eat here almost every day. It's such a great healthy option and it's very close to my gym. My favorite drinks are the wellness juice and the green smoothie. Watermelon is great, too! The bison cheese steak is delicious in a spinach wrap! And the make your own option keeps you mixing and matching every visit. The teriyaki sauce makes any of them taste good. You HAVE to try the sweet potato mash. The service is wonderful, as well. Y'all are always so friendly : )
Amazing place...healthy shouldn't taste this good! The staff was very friendly and explained all the small details I needed to make the best dining choice I have made in a while...keeper!

This place is a hit or miss. Very inconsistent. We get the angus burgers and they are amazing sometimes and sometimes horrible. Sweet potato fries are usually not cooked properly. I love the food on a good day and on a bad day it just tastes like dirty grill and old oil. I wish it was more consistent.

I was skeptical as I perused the menu today which on yelp has 4 items very strangely lumped together. My bf and I go eat brunch maybe once a week usually the same place, but were trying to be healthier so this seemed cool however far from our house. 

  The staff is incredible. Polite over achievers, really happy smiling bunch. Giving us samples as we waiting for the previous family decide their order. 

Green ginger lime juice was delicious. And a huge size compared to other similar joints. I got the turkey burger on wheat. Huge fresh patty grilled bun vegan cheese heirloom tomato not your average turkey burger. Tofu fries are very seasoned looking but not overwhelmingly spicy. Quite mild Could stand to bump up the heat a little even. Comes on a triangle plate which was fun. 

Bf got the chicken satay. Delicious good size portion excellent plating. Complimentary cucumber water probably was the highlight of it all for me. Id come back just for that. Stiff uninviting tables when you dine in but they're surpringly comfortable.

This location is no bueno! I'll start off by mentioning we go to the location on Rainbow and we are always satisfied.  Why a bad review? I'll preface with our experience the one time we came in about 30 min before closing... we try not to do this because we understand we "hate" the customers that come in right before closing. On that visit, we understood why our food might of seemed rushed (wrap was wrapped loosely, pizza was not as yummy, etc). 

Today, we came in around 5pm. Ordered the BBQ chicken pizza and a wrap. I'm not exaggerating... it seemed like they forgot the BBQ on the "BBQ chicken pizza!!!" There were only BBQ on 2 of the 8 slices!!! I don't quite understand how that can happen.  Next, We ordered "add avocado" on the wrap.  I'm not sh!tting you... a small single slice was added to one side/corner of the "cut in half" wrap.  Last, the wrap was not properly wrapped as it just fell apart.  As a reminder... we go to the location on rainbow often and order the same items. We are definitely going to stop going to this location as every visit is disappointing.  I haven't checked if they are franchised/independently owned between these 2 locations but hopefully they can have more consistency. Until then I'll go elsewhere when around the Flamingo location.

Had to stop into a place that holds two of my most prominent diet words in it's name. I really wish I had more time to try more of the menu, but, very limited amount of time in Vegas.

That said, the breakfast that was served to the table next to me looked amazing and I can't wait to try it.

This go around though, hammered down on the "build my own" with ostrich (check another animal off my "got ya bitch" list of animals consumed!), sketti squash and some mashed sweet taters. Also got an antioxidant blast smoothie (berry mix).

So, the chow.
Ostrich - very lean, and decent. Tried it without the citrus bbq sauce first, and it was ok. Was hoping for a bit of seasoning or something, but, it was just cooked meat and no seasoning help. With the citrus bbq, not bad at all and solid chunk of meat. Texture was and cooked temp were not bad either. All in all, a solid slab of lean meat.

Sketti squash - tasteless and didn't seem to be cooked enough. Was very disappointed in this one. I'm usually a huge fan of this and make it my own quite a bit (gives me something to do when my madre delivers 12 giant squashes from her garden). But, a little citrus bbq made it tolerable to wolf down like a desert coyote.

Mashed sweet taters - very good. Was really happy to see this on the menu as a carb option. I hadn't had them in a while, and was pleasantly surprised to have a solid plate of mashed sweets. Perfectly fluffy, not stringy (which sweet taters can be when mashed thanks to the fibers), and solid flavor. Only thing missing was a chance to throw some cinnamon on them. If you've  never done that before, give it a go. Fantastic. I promise.

Antioxidant smoothie - Great flavor, miss on the texture. I knew it'd be a bit think and chunky thanks to the apples (without an amazing juicer, apples are a prick to deal with). But, was hoping this place would have a juicer that'd take that away. Not so. 

In any event, smoothie and food rang up over $24. Considering the ingredients and if I were to order something similar elsewhere, I'm sure it'd be close to that too. So, not overly fussy with the price.

Healthy options if you don't feel like cooking after leaving the gym!

I used to come here a lot after my workouts since it is in the same shopping center as LVAC. Everything has the calories listed for the health conscious people.  The food is good and a little pricey which I don't mind since it is a lot healthier than Mickey D's.

The wellness drink is the only green drink I have ever been able to drink... and actually enjoy! It just tastes like apples to me, and they sneak in a ton of healthy other stuff like kale etc. All of their food has been pretty good as well.

Overpriced and underwhelming, this clean and organized store is light and spacious, and the staff are really polite and friendly. I also love how they have quite a few local business cards and promo materials at the pickup counter where you get your drinks- shows that they are involved in the local community, which I really like to see.

That being said, their smoothies and wraps are each around $8, which sounds about on par with other similar businesses- and for the smoothies I would say it's about right.
But I was not impressed with my tofu/chorizo breakfast wrap- I asked for it in a spinach wrap, which I use frequently at home to make my own wraps, and this one was not particularly full. Most bites had more overlapping layers of tortilla than filling or veggies. On top of that, the menu lists the wrap as coming with "a side of tofu homefries"- this sounded really cool to me and I was excited to check it out.
Imagine my surprise when I open my take out box in my car and realize that a "side" consists of exactly THREE crouton-sized pieces of tofu. They were tasty, but considering I spent $8 on my meal and my take out box was half empty, I'm not pleased. I genuinely don't know if someone was in a hurry and forgot my side, or if three pieces really constitutes a portion- it doesn't to me.

I might come back, but it won't be for food- which is really disappointing, because everything sounds great.

Side note: If you check in on Yelp, you get a dollar off of a juice or smoothie, which helps a bit with the pricing.

Very good. Wellness drink is refreshing and French toast is hearty, sweet, and delicious. Big portion. Definitely not "fast food" meaning your gonna wait 10 minutes for food. Could use another location in Highlands Ranch!

It's been awhile since I ate at this place... I wanna say over a year? I've had nothing, but good experiences whenever I was here! They offer a good variety of meals for people who are watching their diet. They offer salads, burgers, sandwiches, bowls, smoothies, and juices. 
 
I came here for dinner with my girlfriend today and was pleased at how clean it still is after being around for couple years. The staff was very friendly and answered any questions we had regarding the menu. I ordered the bison burger and my girlfriend ordered the bison cheesesteak. Definitely not the healthiest things, but we were hungry... GAINZ. One thing I love about them is that they always have the cucumber water and it tastes so refreshing! We sat outside because the weather was nice and our meals did not take too long to make as well. The server brought it out to us and made sure we had everything that we needed. The bison burger was amazing! I got it medium rare and glad I did because you can feel the juices with every bite! They cooked it perfectly and it definitely tasted a lot cleaner than your usual burger. My girlfriend enjoyed her cheesesteak and took half of it home because the other half got her full. We got tofu fries as our side and I suggest anyone to get it! It's so good! The price range for the two items is around $10-$12 each I believe. Couldn't remember the exact price. Overall I prefer this over protein source as they have better tasting food! Price is about the same.

I've eaten here a couple time's great fresh tasting food and very healthy.
the Low Carb Caesar Salad With Grilled Chicken Breast is the best salad i've ever had.

Everything about this place is amazing. You can leave here feeling full and not guilty for having just eaten  that. The food is not only healthy but tastes amazing. It's top notch in my book.  I've tried pretty much everthing  on the menu from there burgers to there wraps and I'm quite impressed.  I love this place.

I still come here just for the food because there is nothing else close that offers healthY options. The staff is standoffish. I don't know if it's because it's 7a and they don't want to be there or what. But if you can, go to the Eastern location. Everyone there is so much more friendly and welcoming.
Wellness drink my absolute fav!!! I tried the veggie burger & although it is made fresh...it was a little dry. Needs some hummus or some type of cilantro pesto something....overall I'm a fan!

I was very impressed with this place! I am new to Vegas and was looking to try a few places like this in the area. 

There's a similar establishment across the parking lot. However, I went there and enjoyed the food but the staff was rude. 

Greens and Protein had both delicious, nutrient dense food and extremely friendly and helpful staff. I was sitting outside and a manager was leaving to go home. He said goodbye to all three tables on his way out. Small things like that earn my business back every time!

I also love that the menu includes caloric values which is helpful to me on a contest prep diet. 

Highly recommend!
Love this place. Good & fresh food!! Salmon & sautéed broccoli. Their sweet potato fries is also so good. Not to mention their juices are so fresh & satisfying. I'm always craving one!

Food was overpriced and the cashier didn't explain that the juices were not "juiced" but broken down by a masticating machine. So we had a full on conversation about posting that information up. Gave this place a 2 because the owner was somewhat accommodating. I didn't enjoy my juice at all, so they have me a bottled water. So, I basically bought a $5 bottle of water and some egg whites and ground turkey sausages that took 15 minutes to make. Mind you, I was one out of two customers.

yummy! I love this place! Sadly, my husband is not into it as much as I am so I can only go there by myself...or when I force him to go with me :) Yeah some of the stuff are not as tasty as others. Learn what you like from the menu and then you will be just fine.

Not bad at all!! This healthy food chain is pretty fantastic. It is super clean, service is friendly, and the food is good. They have their calorie counts clearly listed, and tons of options! I was actually pretty overwhelmed by all of the choices. Most items average close to $10, so this isn't the cheapest lunch spot, but all things considered (including the refreshing-and free- cucumber water), I can't gripe about spending a few extra dollars.

Ok...so sorry it's been a while. Just noticed the owner is REALLY on top of things. (I'm just now seeing a old response). The location on Rainbow is amazing. I never used the coupon but don't need to. I've found my spot & I will continue to go there. I have to get my tofu fries! Yum! Thank you to the owner once again for being so passionate about his business!

Well... I seem to have forgotten that healthy things don't taste as good as deep fried not healthy things.  

I stopped by on my lunch because I wanted a smoothie to sip on throughout the afternoon at work.  When I walked in, I immediately liked the environment.  Everything was open and clean.  There was only one person in front of me, who was finishing paying.  She and the man behind the register were having a friendly conversation... that continued for quite some time and in to the time where she was waiting for her food.  I was only slightly annoyed since I was on a time constraint.

I ended up ordering the Green Leaf Berry Blast with soy because it sounded both delicious and tasty.  Upon receiving it, I was surprised at its brownish color (which later understandably turned green due to the veggies in it).   My first sip was a shocker... I was not a fan.  I drink soy milk all the time in replacement of regular milk.  There was just a taste that reminded me of liquid Maalox.  I honestly think that my choice on the menu was just a poor one and I would have been better off with a juice.  Next time, I will definitely opt for one of those.  I feel bad that I wasted over $8, but I've definitely learned my lesson!

I love that Greens and Proteins is a health-conscious restaurant that offers vegetarian/vegan options! . 

The food is amazing and the customer service is excellent! I love the G&P veggie burger, tofu fries, grilled vegetable wrap, hummus and pita, the build your own meal, (with tofu, edamame, sweet potato mash and aged balsamic reduction) acai bowl, granola crusted french toast, pancakes, and the banana bread, made with walnuts and chocolate chips! ANNOUNCEMENT: They are now serving sweet potato fries - yum! I LOVE that they do not fry any meat or fish, which prevents cross contamination for those who have dietary concerns. 

My meat-eating fiance likes the mini Ahi tostadas, Ahi protein salad, the California grilled chicken wrap and all of the above! He has yet to try a burger but they have only been open for a couple of weeks. We still have more to try!

I have been trying to eat healthier and be more aware of my portions, especially with the wedding around the corner. It is extremely helpful to have an idea of how many calories I am consuming per meal. However, I have let them know they should add the calorie count for the tofu fries - for consistency, of course. No joke, but I have been losing some weight after working out, along with eating a couple of meals here per week.

It is safe to say, I am a bit obsessed. Enjoy!

*New location in North Las Vegas. Please see my review.

The foods great and It's great to see vegan options on the menu, but recently when I called in my order of a veggiechino smoothie (delicious!) I was told it would be ready in 5 mins, when I got there to pick up my order it wasn't ready and I ended up waiting 20 mins before I left smoothie-less and disappointed. The foods really really great, they just need a little work on their customer service.

I like the idea of healthy food as an alternative to the usual fast food fair, but they always take so long and the food is just not that good. I like the menu but I feel like they could add a bit more flavor. The healthy food I make at home tastes good, their food is quite bland.

My husband and I stopped here on our way home to California and I fell in love!
They have a fantastic menu full of good for you food!
I wanted to badly to eat something, but I had eaten about an hour before I went but we did want juice.
I got a ginger limeade and it was fantastic! 
Only reason I gave 4 not 5 stars is that it's a bit pricey, but with what they use I get it.
Next time I am in Vegas I will definitely be going back!

Really savory food, great customer service and overall we were all pleasantly surprised. We ordered 2 kids burgers, a salmon plate and the cheese stake sandwich. Oh' also ordered the hummus plate, not my favorite.

Portions were fantastic, great tasting food and portions were pretty satisfying.

Keep it rolling guys. We'll definetly come back!
This place was AWESOME! We got the BBQ pizza and chicken sausage pizza. Sooo good! Service was great as well.

Got the green leaf berry smoothie. It was horrible. Didn't say anything until a worker asked how it was. I bluntly said, "This tastes like sh*t." Which it did because the worker said it doesn't even look the right color. He then asked if he could make it right. I asked if he could make me a peanut butter banana instead. He came back with a better tasting concoction. Way to do service recovery. Thumbs up to Kevin (the worker who saved the night.)

Update: All I drank after the gym was the shakes. I ended up tasting them again...Something in those drinks just didn't agree with me. My girlfriend has the chorizo wrap and didn't have any issues. She enjoyed it and didn't get sick.

Great location here in the same plaza as LVAC. The food is average pricing, but I think the drinks are a bit pricey (over $8 for a juice drink)... but I guess with the quality ingredients, it can be expensive to be healthy, right? Got the Wellness drink (can't remember the exact name) and at first I wasn't a fan, but it tasted better with each sip, plus super healthy. They do have a good menu with drinks, breakfast options, and wraps/sandwiches/etc.

I have been meaning too get this off my bookmark tonight finally did. I always heard about the location on the opposite end of world for me. Once learned about there newest location excited about chance too get my Greens and Proteins on. I no means hardcore comes too healthy eating but generally try all my meals healthy. Truly is no place better in Vegas comes too healthy menu. Literally they breakdown the calories on just about every menu item. Offer Build Your Own Custom Meal pick your proteins, greens, grains, and sauces. Again they have everything broken down too calories. It was my first time daunting too pick choose as my first taste. I kind of in the mood of burger so went with the Ostrich Burger and try so got the 7 Vegetable Broccoli Cheese Soup. 

The soup was good. It nothing Wow factor but overall solid soup. It nice creamy base soup but had nice thickness and full body with the cheese (assume cheddar they use. The color really nice. Times order any vegetable soup not have that vibrant or look like vegetable. Soup was right on. Nice HOT!!

The Ostrich Burger was delicious. I believe one first times having it. It lean meat. So thinking might be dried out but still moist and had nice flavor. The garnishes of lettuce and tomatoes really fresh looking added too my burger. The sides lot too choose from but went with the fried tofu. I scared at first. I enjoy tofu but not seasoned right just bland. The fried tofu was hit for me. It had nice seasonings on the outside and enjoy the aioli dipping sauce for them. They also offer Bison as protein. I see that in my future...

They cook everything too order so takes time but very much worth the wait. The only thing not fan of is the interior is REALLY boring. I understand still relatively new but plain white walls all around and not much of vibe inside. It loses appeal waiting but once you get your food more then MAKES up for it. It kind of pricey menu. Still not going too hold me back try more of the menu.

Their food and smoothies are great to have after a good workout!! Their fruits/veggies are fresh not frozen!! :) I actually had to ask them to remake my smoothie because it was kind of runny - but the second one they remade for me was perfect!

This is a nice place to go if you're looking for something healthy and relatively quick. I had the emu burger, and it was awesome, and the juices were really outstanding. I really like that they post all of the calories on the menu so you know what's in your food. The con, it's really quite pricey, 6+ $ for smoothies/drinks, and sandwiches start at about 10$. It would be easy to have a 25$ lunch by yourself here. Noticed they are however vegan, vegetarian and HCG diet friendly.

We eat at this location pretty often, the service is always fast and friendly. The clientele for the most part seems to be people coming after a work out at the LVAC across the way so the dress code is super casual. 
The build your own protein plate is the way to go for us. The salmon is always cooked perfect but the sizes of the pieces of salmon can vary a lot! I always get sliced avocado and mashed sweet potato as my sides with the balsamic dressing. Highly recommend!
For breakfast, the French toast is a favorite with my kids... they are crusted with granola. Yum!
I have tried a few of their smoothies and have enjoyed them all. 
The only downside is the prices. Be prepared to pay the price to eat healthier!

Lots of menu options and they give you a good filling amount of food.  Wraps, burgers, soups even lots of breakfast options and so many healthy and vegan options.  Great place I hope more locations open up.
Courteous staff and an owner who "loves" food.  Food that is both delicious and nutritious
This place is fantastic. Just great healthy food for a very good price. Most of the juice drinks are great and the bison patties are awesome!

My absolute new favorite place to go.  This is even better than Rachel's Kitchen (sorry - I still adore you).  Ingredients are clearly fresh and there is even a bit of love put into the sandwiches.

Big thumbs up for the calorie counts and online ordering.

I first thought this was a national chain as their branding and menu is spot on.  Wouldn't surprise me at all if Greens and Proteins takes over the world!

Greens n Proteins W. Flamingo & Grand Canyon  

After coming here a few times & not being disappointed 
I feel like it's the least I can do is to leave a review. 
Following along with the rest of the health nut community I've decided to start counting those  calories & macros. In my pursuit of this fun filled journey of Greens n Proteins I've found that when i can combine healthy food with flavor I become happy. From Juices to shakes . Wraps to bison cheese steaks potato fries to Quinoa Salads. Its definitely a place I leave feeling satisfied and not disgusted with myself! Their service has been great the 4-5 times I've been there. It can get busy at times and waiting for your food for 15 mins  can definitely be a possibility. 

Breakfast Favorites 

Tofu Soy Chorizo Burrito,Greek Scramble, 
Protein Pancakes, Tomato Mozzarella Basil Frittata 

Salad Favorites 

Skinny Chef Salad, Ahi Protein Salad, 


Other favorites : Buffalo Chicken Wrap , Bison Cheese Steak & The Wellness Smoothie!

After days of gorging on Vegas buffets and other unhealthy foods, we were craving something  healthy after a workout. We stumbled across this place and were delighted. They have four different kinds of pizza crust--we opted for thin crust with BBQ chicken. We also got a wellness shake, which was very good.

Paid my first visit to Greens and Proteins for a healthy bite to eat after a not so healthy day of eating. I ordered an order of the chicken satay and had managed to snag a few bites of my man's teriyaki chicken wrap. I wanted to try their smoothies or juices, but I convinced myself to settle with their complimentary cucumber water to drink. Frankly, I couldn't justify paying more for juice than I paid for my entrée. (Huge cheapo moment). 

I enjoyed my satay as it was a good amount of skewers and actually tasted like I had ordered them from a Thai restaurant. The wrap was okay... lacked a little flavor as I couldn't taste any sauce, but it wasn't bad. I liked the tofu fries I ordered along with it. 

One of the best parts was seeing all the pre/post workout LVAC members who entered and exited as we ate. This not only gave me more motivation to get my booty in the gym, but also showed that this business was thriving and providing great, healthy options for those in town. I love seeing a place with active "regulars." 

On my next visit, I hope not to be too cheap to not try the juices and smoothies. :)

Newer restaurant to the area, I had to try since their motto is "Healthy". 
I had the skinny chef salad with Ranch dressing - good salad for lunch. I got the small portion, I can only imagine how large the large portion is, so really impressed with the sizes. I'll definitely be going back to try more of the food and the juices. 
I do like the fact that instead of sugar, the sweetener choice for the juices is Agave Nectar. Not quite paleo, but a better option than sugar. 
My only comment is I wish they had a grass-fed burger and organic veggie options.

The smoothies are delicious! Customer service is good and the food is passable. Although, my boyfriend ordered the Buffalo Chicken Strips and the sauce was a little too spicy. I also preferred more berries on the Summer Berry Salad I ordered. (But), regardless of our personal preference on the food, it was well worth the money we spent. I will definitely return.
My favorite place for a healthy meal and know that I put something good in my body.  Bison burger with tofu is what I usually order , it's a bit pricy tho .

Great restaurant with an amazing concept fusing super healthy organic with a medium type /Upper class-fast food Service. They have multiple locations however I have found the flamingo location the most consistent when it comes accurate meal preparation. The majority of the menu is set up so that you can pick your own protein greens and carbs individually and is very nice for people that like food cooked their particular way. You can tell when the owner is not at the store location-However if you bring it to their attention that they messed up on your order they give you a wonderful attitude and often replace the meal/but always try to make good.

Greens and Proteins overall is always great, but the Flamingo location is really excellent.  The staff is always very nice, friendly and helpful with the menu.  The dining area is clean, stocked and well kept.  The chairs are a little uncomfortable, but that's only because I'd prefer to lay on a couch after my workouts.

You come here for a reason...lifestyle food that is not available at most places.  It is no coincidence that it is located next to LVAC.  Greens and Proteins has lots of high protein meats, low-fat options, vegetarian options, vegan options, good grains, and gluten free options to fit several lifestyle diets.

I am a fan of their buffalo meat steak & cheese wrap and their green shake specifically, but if you're looking for the types of food offered here it is easy to find something on the menu.  They also provide caloric and fat content info on their menu.

Don't come here if you are not into lifestyle food.  It will most likely disappoint.  There are plenty of tasty items for all types of eater, but you're paying a little more here because of the type of food.  Also, several of the healthy options are a bit bland...ie jicama fries.  It is still a solid place that is filling a niche and doing it pretty well.

LOVE this location!! Amanda and her team are fantastic. The food is always awesome and prompt, the place is always clean and customers always look happy! Wish this place was in California, but it's a perk of coming to Vegas!!!

Delicious spot for lunch - lots of healthy options with easy modifications to get it just how you like it.  Perfect for those of us who are careful or picky about what we eat and often annoy servers with special requests. Everything I tried (from both my order and my husbands) was fantastic! Don't skip the sweet potato fries.

Okay so I came back to Greens and Proteins. Not much has changed which is a good thing. The staff were again friendly and informative. They do really try to have the answers to their food. I kind of stumped them today but it doesn't take away at all from how I feel about this establishment. The only thing they didn't know was whether or not there soy products are organic. I think as a health restaurant that should be something that should be known. But other than that people were great. The food came out hot for the hot food and cold for the cold food. It was cooked to the right temperature. The food does taste fresh. The food is always good. The restaurant is clean. Even the bathroom is clean. I kind of use the bathroom as a way to make sure the entire place is clean. If they keep their bathroom clean they for damn sure will keep their restaurant clean. The only reason I don't give them a five star is because they aren't the best food I have ever had. But damn it they are good! I would recommend this place to everyone. Specifically the one on Grand Canyon and Flamingo. That's the only one I've been to. Keep up the good work Greens and Proteins! You always satisfy me!

Wellness drink was delicious. I also had the greek breakfast and the green shake, both were great!
The manager needs to work on his customer service, but all of the other employees were nice.
Overall good place, something for everyone, vegas, vegitarian, or not.

Tried this place after a Pilates class down the street. I love it! I wish It was closer to where I live. I legit copied the tofu and jicama fries at home. They were soooo good and truly an awesome alternative to reg fries. Yummy cucumber water too....and its free!!!

The Eastern location is way better. It was freezing cold in there! I hate when restaurants are too cheap to turn on the heat. I don't enjoy eating my meals bundled up in my winter coat and still be freezing. My soup came out thick as I like it, but the tofu fries were way thinner than the Eastern location and one of them was half the length. See the pic I posted. 

There was also a customer who seemed to be a regular harassing all the women who walked in. Then, the customer walked into the kitchen and just started talking to the kitchen staff. He had no hairnet on so it's possible his hair was falling off into the food, then he just grabbed his own food from the kitchen.

Just went to greens and proteins because it was recommended by my neighbor. First of all the place is spotless and the staff is friendly. I was skeptical because healthy food tends to be poor in taste but this is not the case at G&P. The chocolate and peanut butter shake was excellent and I had no clue there were vegetables mixed in. Then the meal came out and wow the whole wheat French toast was scrumptious ! This place has completely changed my mind about health food tasting like cardboard that's for sure. The owner himself even came out to greet me and ask how my meal was. I give five stars for the original recipe, the cleanliness of the establishment and the fact that the owner has direct involvement in the operation. This is always indicates that someone takes pride in what they do and wants the best quality products/services for their customers. I'll be back soon.

It's been awhile since I've been back so I thought I'd give it another shot before my workout. 

There was a gentleman behind the counter instead of a woman. He was nice and was able to make my order vegan. He was also kind enough to sub out a non vegan sauce for one I would like. 

I ordered a veggie burger without the bun since the bun wasn't vegan and a gluten free vegan bun was $3 more. After consuming the burger, the bun wouldn't have made a difference. It was bland and...well bland. The tofu fries on the other hand were amazing! Add the BBQ sauce and wow! 

Service was a lot better from my first visit last year. I was asked if I needed anything else after my food was delivered and I asked if silverware was in a specific area. The gentleman then offered to grab them for me instead. The staff seemed more cheerful than what I experienced last year.
However I can see why they would be Debbie downers. They have people coming in asking for sparkling water in a different language. Just say sparkling water! 

Overall, this visit was better than the first. And to the lady who was asked to leave because your dog wasn't a service dog, there's still no sign saying service dogs only.  Remember, it's a food establishment...with an open juice bar. I'm sure most people would like their juices without animal hair.
Tried something off the HCG menu.  It was Good.  I look forward to trying other items.  Very clean and nice atmosphere.

Love this place! I fell I love with the Summer Berry Spinach Salad with a side of tofu fries! I'm not even vegetarian. Every time I come here I feel guilty for not being in my gym clothes. I wish there was one next to every Starbucks so I could eat healthy everywhere I travel.

Had the summer berry salad with chicken and it was delicious! My only complaint is that the large salad was not that large and $16 so it is a bit pricey but everything on the menu looked so good, I can't wait to try more!

I have to agree with some of the other posters about the bland food.  Decided to check this place out for the first time with a friend and unfortunately, can't see myself returning.  I ordered a rough cut roma tomato salad and the tortilla soup.  My friend ordered what looked like a mix of steamed veggies and rice (steamed broccoli, kale, mixed squash/zucchini).   The salad they brought out for me was mainly radicchio and frisee (the red/purple lettuce and the light green "fuzzy" lettuce just in case you're not sure what that is); two of the most bitter greens that I'm least fond of.  The dressing was a bitter vinaigrette with lemon, I believe.  The tomato slices appeared to have been sitting out for a while; not fresh at all.  There were some spinach leaves thrown in along with some cucumber.  I took a bite and was hit with bland bitterness.  At first, I thought there just wasn't dressing but the guy explained that there was dressing on it.  The tortilla soup came out and did not look like soup - it appeared very thick, almost like orange hummus.  I dipped in and it tasted very sweet, like pumpkin, without any type of "mexican/tortilla" flavor.  I couldn't force myself to eat it although I was starving.  I told my friend she should try the soup to see if it was just me.  She seemed very hesitant by the look of it.  She took a dip and stated, "There is no flavor....it's just...sweet?"  I didn't quite understand what I had ordered.  Her meal came out; just steamed veggies and brown rice.  I tried some and it was fine but I can't fathom paying the $13 for this when it is one of the easiest things to make at home....steamed veggies and rice.  I lost out on $12 myself.
