I couldn't eat my food and soon pushed it to the side so I could just focus on hang time and not the hunger pangs in my stomach.  When I left, I came home and made an amazing organic salad, topped with LOTS of avocado.  They should hire me to improve their salad menu. :)

Vegan, gf & raw! So excited! 
THOSE WITH CELIAC'S/GLUTEN INTOLERANCE BE CAREFUL: see below

I was very excited to discover this chain had opened up on the southwest part of town. They are ingeniously located near LVAC, making it easy to get a healthy recovery meal after your workout. We ordered: Pumpkin spice chai latte, veggie garden burger, and bison burger. Total after tip= $38.10 (we took our food to go). A little on the high end $$$. Our food came out pretty quickly, but our smoothie took longer than expected. I was hoping to get that first and sip on that as an appetizer while we waited for our food. I don't know if they forgot about our smoothie or was just slow on making it. I did notice however, people after me get their drink before me, they also knew him on a first name basis and gave him the extra out of the blender in a separate cup. They should treat everyone as if they are a regular. Talk about not making me feel special. 

~Pumpkin Chai Tea Latte; Chai Tea, Pumpkin, Green Cabbage, Carrots, Butternut Squash, Flax Seeds, Ginger, Cinnamon, Nutmeg, Walnuts, Agave Nectar. This was really good and very filling. Although the cabbage was pronounced, the smoothie was well balanced and tasted raw (the way I like it).

~Bison burger w/ jicama fries; choice of swiss or cheddar cheese, lettuce tomato and onion on a whole grain bun. He wished he got it with cheddar rather than swiss. "Jicama fries" are just sliced jicama lightly seasoned with what looks/tastes paprika. 

*Veggie garden burger; I was extremely excited because I'm a sucker for alfalfa sprouts. I asked the cashier if the veggie patty was gluten free, as I have had a difficult time finding a veggie patty that does not use "wheat gluten" as a binder. He asked someone on the cooking line, who I assume was a manager, and he said "yes, it's gf, the patty is soy based protein" I took their word for it and gambled the risk. Sure enough I think the veggie patty is glutenous so BEWARE to those with celiac's/gluten intolerance. I got sick, as I do from eating or cross-contaminating with gluten/wheat. I have yet to bring my concern to the attention of the staff. Moving forward, the burger was eh-okay. My gluten free bun was hard (it's difficult to get a soft, buoyant bun using gluten free flour, especially if you're taking your item to go. In the future I will dine in. I ordered my burger with tofu fries. I was told that they dust the tofu blocks with rice flour and fry it in corn oil, so the oil should not be a point of cross contamination, as there isn't anything else with regular flour going into the oil. My burger came with the sprouts, bibb lettuce, tomato, and red onion. I also added vegan cheese, it's shredded.

We also added avocado to our sandwiches ($0.75/burger) for a quarter of an avocado (rip off). I don't mind paying extra for modifications, but make it worth my while and not be so skimpy! At least give me a half an avocado for that price, so that I can have it in every bite as opposed to just half my burger. I was charged extra for vegan cheese, again this would be fine, but there was less than a teaspoon sprinkled on my burger, with a $1.00 up-charge.

Although the food is pricey, it's raw, healthy, and typically quick, right up my alley. I will be back because there is not many others around like this and to inform them of my gf veggie patty concerns. There are just a few "tweeks" they need to adjust before they get the 5th star from me.I hope they properly label their menu on their website and physical menu so gluten free & vegan items are clearly marked. Just remember they do not operate out of a certified gluten free kitchen, but it seems that for the most part they handle issues like cross contamination okay.

Service was exceptional. There was a constant line (with one cashier) at 3:00pm. He was very nice and patient with me since I had a lot of questions.

Horrible service. The staff seemed like it was their first day. I waited 20 minutes for a turkey burger. Then they didn't make my juice, I asked 3 staff members for my drink all said yes and never returned. I had to finally ask for a refund. This place is amateur at best, I didn't expect 5 star service but I expected prompt service and good food! Never again!

Love this pace so much. It's great to know that I can order a healthy meal that will satisfy my belly but best of all my tastebuds. I usually order pick up. I literally live 5 mins away. I call before i leave the house and when i get there, BOOM! my food is ready. Service is fast, and i usually find parking right away out in front. The place inside has a good amount of seating. It's nice and bright inside. Staff is always super friendly & on point. Will continue to order from this place.
Staff is friendly and accommodating to requests with orders but everything else is kind of blah

You know...I'm really not sure what to really rate Greens and Proteins. I like it, it's different...but then again...I'm not too big of a fan. Maybe I need to go here more than once...but with the prices..maybe not. =/

Anyways...my boyfriend and I wanted to start eating healthier. We're not health freaks but we don't want to become obese one day either. He heard about this place through his co workers. The thought of "making your own meal" intrigued him so we were willing to give it a try. We walked in knowing their prices were on the higher end side.

We both decided to get the "make your own meal" plate. To sum it up, PORTIONS ARE SMALL. It was actually perfect for me because I get full easily anyways but for all you "big eaters"...be warned. This MAY NOT fill you up. Yes, it IS a healthy restaurant afterall. Yes, the whole point in small portions is because it is healthy for you. But I'm just saying....
 It may fill me up but PERSONALLY, it still left something for me to desire.

We also got two drinks. He got that green drink (sorry forgot the name of it but I've seen a lot of Yelpers get it) and I got the berry antioxidant smoothie. They tasted different...but a good different. Man....after drinking this, it puts Jamba Juice and Tropical Smoothie to shame. Greens and Proteins smoothie drinks tasted natural and healthy. You can tell it has natural ingredients and fresh fruits and veggies...unlike all the other sugar and crap that maybe be in Jamba and Tropical.

So why 3 stars and not a higher rating? 
-2 stars for the price. It seriously pays to be healthy. =/ I think with 2 drinks and 2 meals ran our bill to $30+ ....for that price, we could have went to Cheesecake Factory lol 

Will we be back? Ehh....maybe...
This place has great vegan options for food and drinks. It's good quality, healthy, and tasty! It is pretty efficiently run as well, do they don't keep you waiting long even if it gets busy.

Again, super pricey but SUPER GOOD! 

It was my first time and it's near my job so I got it to go. I ordered it a little in advance (my fault) so I didn't get to enjoy the tofu fries as much as I would have dining in. The seasoning was good on them but I definitely wouldn't recommend them for takeout unless you are eating them immediately. (Duh) 

Got the bison burger because I read multiple reviews. I got mine with cheddar, turkey bacon, and avocado. So SO good!!! The flavor of this burger was amazing. Over a week after eating it and I'm drooling on the keyboard over this review. I didn't think I would get a burger of all things here but I am so happy I did! 

I love juices so I tried the green ginger juice (don't remember the exact name) it was probably the best juice I've ever purchased. I love ginger and this juice was just too good. I will definitely be stopping back for at least the juice bar if  I don't feel like spending $20 on lunch.
Extremely nommynommy I have never been a fan of tofu and today trying a Greek scramble the tofu in it was amazing

G&P is my go to healthy fast food restaurant. I get the same thing every time I go there: salmon, sweet potato mash, broccoli, and lemon butter AND pesto sauces. How can you go wrong with that? It's delicious and healthy and got that Mediterranean diet on lock! The water has chlorophyll in it and the vibes are great. I've been to both locations and it's always dependable for healthy and bomb food. I hope more restaurants like this stem from their initiative!

Good quality clean eating meals and smoothies. It can be a little pricey but it's worth it. I'm a big fan of the BBQ chicken pizza on lavash bread. If you want to make your own healthy dish, they have a build your own selection! 

Convenient location next to the LVAC. Good customer service and clean environment.

Really love their options and portion sizes. The salads are very delicious and the bison burger is LOADED with protein! The taste is very delicious and I've yet to try their drinks. Btw they have alternatives to Coke and Pepsi for fountain drinks and they're really good too. It's too bad they don't have one by my house in long beach.

Great food and great service - awesome waxing salon next door I usually get my brows done while they blend my smoothie. Greens and proteins have all options for breakfast lunch and dinner as well as snacks and smoothies - no more excuses for fast food! Prices are a bit on the high side but who can put a price on health.

in a world of unhealthy choices greens and proteins provides you with nothing but the highway quality food made to treat your taste buds right but also your health.. This place is a life saver for anyone trying to eat healthy on the go

This place is just eh. Not very impressed. I understand this is a healthier place but their food is lacking some serious flavor. 
I would come here if I was dieting but would much rather go somewhere else and modify my meal by asking for veggies on the side, no sauce, etc. than to come here and have a "healthy" one.
Plenty of other healthy places with better flavor.

If I'm completely depleted after a workout and the thought of making a green smoothie or cooking breakfast makes me even more tired, you'll find me here picking up a Green Shake with Almond Milk. You can also see them cutting up fresh fruit and veggies in between orders. I have yet to venture out into their other drinks, but I did recently try their Breakfast Burrito that definitely fueled me post-workout. I know a lot of people say this place is over-priced, but healthy ingredients are generally pricier and what you are really paying for is the convenience and knowing/seeing your food is freshly prepared. And......they have packets of Cholula for to-go!
Excellent food with prompt, very friendly service. Priced extremely well with huge portions. Smoothies are delicious. Highly recommended.

I had been wanting to try this place for a while and finally got the chance. I built my own plate with chicken, brown rice, broccoli and teriyaki sauce. I kind of hoped they would mix everything up for me but they didn't. It's cool though, I realize a lot of people may want to make that decision for themselves. The food is delicious and doesn't seem overly salty like so many restaurants. The nutrition and macronutrient info is on the menu by each item which makes it super helpful for those of us who keep track of that stuff! The only odd thing that I noticed was they didn't have any natural sweeteners (like honey or stevia), only white sugar and artificial stuff. A place that prides itself on health should probably start offering better options! But, it didn't affect me that day or anything so not holding it against them. The servers were friendly and the menu is quite extensive. I'd love to come back and try the smoothies and some of their other items!

It's so nice to have a healthy, quick option to grab a bite to eat. The menu is full of delicious options with low fat content and fresh ingredients. Yes, the menu is a little on the pricy side, but you get what you pay for. Juices are made with real fruits and vegetables and healthy ingredients are not cheap for anyone!
The inside is bright with vibrant green walls and large windows. The kitchen is open so you can watch the employees make your juices. The staff is always friendly and they bring your food out to you when it is ready. I appreciate this opposed to your number being called out. It feels more personal. 

*Gluten free options
*Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner
*Fresh juices
*Seafood
*Bison
*Wraps
*Pizza
*Cucumber water

I get food here often.  Today they decided to not put my tofu fries in the order.  I don't see how hard it is to ensure the customer get what they pay for.  I guess if I decide to return I will just have to treat them like incompetent fast food workers and checks entire order.  This sucks because I really like their food.

Just because 0 is not an option!! What a stupid staff! i told them no pecans in my pancakes! They made it with pecans. And when I called them the manager told me they will make another one without pecans. And when I went to pick up my pancakes they told me that there is a pecan already in a butter they use for making the pancakes. And he told me that he didn't tell me to come back for another one! And they didn't offer to refund me my order. I was speechless...I am defenetly not going back!
I wish I had discovered this place sooner! I love that it is truly healthy food AND it's delicious.
Of all the places in Las Vegas we chose this place because of its healthy flavorful food!  I love it!
Definitely a fan and will be making this a daily occurrence while in town.  Tried the Green Smoothie & Straight to the Heart both are great!

Tasty, healthy, servin' it up with love little cafe that specializes in hi protein homemade food.

Filled with gym-bunnies eating after the work-out, definitely keeping their trainers and diets happy!

The menu looks simple from fist appearances, but they really try to get creative with the flavors, and foods. For example, instead of potatoes, yummy little tofu bites. Over all I was impressed.

Love love love this place!!! Its the perfect place to start eating healthier and transitioning yourself into a healthier lifestyle. My "go to" is a create your own, where u pick a protein, a green, a grain, & a sauce. If I'm splurging I go with the gluten free BBQ chicken pizza. I myself have Celiac disease (gluten intolerance) and have to be very picky about where & what I eat; its nice that the staff is well educated on which items, including sauces & dressing, fit my food requirements. Also, staff is very friendly! Can't wait to see this place grow more and more popular!
Great place to eat healthy. Food is delicious and there are a lot of options. Only issue is it is a little pricy

I am on a new road to healthier eating and this is a great place to go to for a smoothie or a light meal. I tried the Green Shake and I am hooked! I also ordered some broccoli soup, hummus/pita, and a Margherita pizza with the Vegan option. The shake was refreshing,filling, and delicious. The food however was just not my style. I saw other people enjoying their meals. I would say nothing was wrong with the food at all. It was made fresh and with good looking ingredients. I just think as of now, I'm more on a juicing/smoothie kick. The open plan of the kitchen was nice to be able to see your food being made in front of you. I liked the modern and clean look of the decor. There was a large patio to enjoy the spring/fall seasons here in Vegas. 
My only gripe.. the noise level!
Bring earplugs. When they get those blenders going... It's LOUD!!
I die for their vegan burger wrapped in cabbage with tofu fries. Seasoned to perfection and portioned great for a curvy girl on the go!

Still one of my favorite places to go when I'm visiting Vegas. I always get the Wellness Drink without Stevia. It's sweet enough with the fruit that you can't taste the greens. If you check in on yelp you get $1 a juice or smoothie. The person who helped us out...Steve? was great. Very personable and gave great recommendations.

Still waiting for this place to come out to LA!

Dining out is so hard when you're trying to stay healthy, but this place takes the temptation out of the dining out experience because everything on their menu is good for you! I've tried the turkey burger, the bison burger, and a wrap (can't recall which one) and was pleased with each. The tofu fries are really yummy!!! This place is pretty expensive though, but I guess when you're putting good stuff into your body it's worth it

Good Lookin' and Healthy is what you feel when you head in here for a snack! 
I enjoy this cause it's faster than me shopping for the ingredients and doing it myself when I'm in a crunch for time! 
Grab and go is how I feel when I stop for a smoothie and/or juice! 
Doc would be proud of me! 
Just wish they had more juices!           (((o(*??*)o))) over all satisfied!!! I like the fact that it's yum stuff

This is my first time at this location. I love their food and juices.

Had the Harvest Kale salad and pumpkin loaf. The salad was delicious and very "citrusy." I'm not sure if the pumpkin bread is seasonal but it was also very good.

My sister had the turkey club and sweet potato french fries and said it was good.

Solid food all-around!

Whenever I am back on my healthy kick, Greens & Proteins is my go to! Normally, I would say it is a little overpriced, but for great quality food, sometimes you have to pay a little extra.

Bison Cheesesteak Wrap is my go to! When I'm being really good, I'll turn it into a salad, with no tortilla. This place is awesome to modifying anything that I get here.

The staff is awesome and very attentive and friendly. Always great when it comes to recommendations and taking care of their guests! 

Great place for a quick bite or a casual luncheon!
Fave fuel station for post or pre workouts...or to grab a healthy bite. Tofu fries, wellness drink, green shake and raw macho nacho are my faves. Vegan and vegetarian friendly. Free wifi too.

I have recently found myself on a low-carb, high protein kick.  For that reason, I thought Greens and Proteins would be right up my alley.  I visited their Green Valley location and found the food to be a healthy alternative, but a little on the pricey side compared to other restaurants that offer similar fare (Rachel's Kitchen, Daily Wellness, etc).

About a week later I decided to give the Greens and Proteins location at Flamingo and the 215 a try and I was greatly disappointed.  The service was very slow and when I brought the issue to the manager's attention his reaction was trite and condescending.  He did nothing to rectify the situation and told me I had no reason to complain.  When I went to eat my to-go order, an ostrich burger lettuce wrap, I found it was topped with a rotten avocado and it was missing the turkey bacon I ordered.  

For the price point (my meal was $18) I found the service and quality to be lacking.  On the upside, after reading another negative Yelp! review of this establishment, I found a great nearby "healthy alternative" restaurant that I will be returning to for sure.

Very good first time dining at this place! The menu is kind of expensive but then again what can you expect from a place that aims for healthy eating! They have this $1 off coupon that you can use on the $7.50 smoothie drink :-/ it was ok.. I ordered the "Wellness" drink which I could've made at home myself nothing special..I feel like they should give more than a dollar off that's not even covering the tax on the drink itself but that's neither here nor there.. On to the food.. So my friend talked me into ordering the Bison Cheese Steak which honestly was good but for sure not worth $10.99 I got a pinch on cheese steak with ALL that bread and some light mozzarella.. I enjoyed the tofu fries more than anything else to be honest! I guess I'll just have to try something different on the menu because I won't let one mediocre experience take away from the whole dining experience..

Before I placed my order, I asked the girl at the register what Greens and Proteins specialties are and she said make your own plate, and the BBQ chicken pizza. I decided on the pizza. 

My order came about 20 min later maybe even a bit longer which I think is too long for a fast casual restaurant. When I took the first bite of the pizza all I could taste was the BBQ sauce. While the BBQ sauce did grow on me after a few bites, I almost thought it tasted a little too unique. Additionally, if a "traditional" BBQ sauce is not used, the menu should specify the type of BBQ sauce being used (citrus BBQ sauce). Now on to the chicken, I did not like the spice on the chicken and it was a little dry. The positives were that the pizza is low calorie so you can finish the whole thing; the fat free ranch is delicious; the lavash bread gave the pizza a nice crunch.

Towards the end of my meal, I called over the manager to give him some feedback. While I appreciated him sitting down with me and having an open conversation, I did not like the fact that he said normally I would offer a refund but in this case I don't think we did anything wrong. I wasn't asking for a refund just offering my honest feedback. 

Overall, I like the concept of the restaurant and I am willing to come back to try more items on the menu.
My go to spot for healthy and tasty food. Love the bulgogi bowl. Friendly workers and my only slight complaint is that it's a tad pricey here.

This is the best place to go after a workout. Not a good place to go if you are super hungry. You won't feel guilty after your workout since they serve sort of healthy entrees. The serving here is smaller than usual and is pricey. 

My bf and I ordered a bison burger (very dry even though my bf mentioned that he wanted it cooked medium), crab wrap and a BBQ chicken pizza. For 3 items, it was almost $40. The crab wrap was not bad. You can see some crab pieces in it. The pizza was okay. Nothing special. 

One thing I liked here is their free cucumber lemon water. Very refreshing! 

Not sure if we will be back.

I so wanted to love this place but it's just not that great. It's possible I ordered entirely the wrong thing, but it also took forever to come out (20 minutes), and then one of the containers exploded (opened) in the car and spilled salad all over the floor. 

The bison burger, which I ordered medium, was way way way overdone. Well done in fact. It was flavorless, and the toppings were soggy even though they were separate from the burger. It came with jicama or tofu fries. I got the jicama fries. They were covered in chili powder. I'm not a fan of chili powder. I love jicama. I also got a caesar salad, which was itself actually good minus the exploding container. The little tub of dressing would not have been enough had I not lost half of the salad to the car floorboards, so that was a blessing in disguise. Burger and salad cost $11+5, fountain drink was $2 or $3. They also offer fancy healthy shakes/smoothies for $6-7. 

Menu not offered in a format other than 10 feet above the registers or glued to the counter at the register. Made it hard to figure out what to order since I couldn't read the options. :/

Wanted to try this place for a while as I live around the corner... Impressed with the skinny chef salad! Was afraid it wouldn't have enough going on, but was wrong. Not the best salad I've ever had but pretty good and definitely filling. Service was good and quick as I got it to go and can't wait to stop by again to try a build your own dish. On
I was so disappointed with this place. Service was trash, food was sub par and super overpriced. I sadly will not ever be returning due to the quality of everything.

I've eaten here a few times and it has been good and healthy every time. I like that I can have a hearty, good meal and stay within a decent calorie range. This morning I had the egg white with turkey sausage and tofu fries. I love the tofu fries- they are fab! They play good music in here too:)

The staff is very helpful! I had my toddler with me when I had to make several orders for friends and the guy assisting me (I'm upset I didn't get his name) offered to assist me bringing it to the car since I had my hands full with my little one. Great staff !

Best healthy place to eat in las vegas. Usually get the wellness drink which is far better tasting then the green drink at whole foods. The tofu fries are as close to healthy fries as you get. Havent tried everything but everything I have tried is very tasty. Best tasting healthy food around.

I must say I was not impressed. My husband is EXTREMELY gluten sensitive  (it's not a fad, but a really big deal, like an allergy) and when trying to explain this to the guy at the counter he became impatient and huffy. I am not sure if he was the manager or what, but regardless of how busy you are, you need to maintain a certain level of professionalism and care about people, especially food allergies. He was dismissive and after we ordered, I was sure they didn't prepare his food correctly. I ordered an albacore salad and it was just "okay". My husband had requested just a bed of rice with bison and veggies, I believe it may have been a custom order. He really liked his, and didn't have a reaction to any of the food, which is a thumbs up. I hate to leave negative reviews but I just wasn't feeling after the guy was a little abrasive. I WILL go back again because I know people have good and bad days and life happens. The smoothie I had was great however. It was a pretty busy place so I look forward to trying it again. Will update review then.

I saw this on my way into Zabbas last week and mentally bookmarked this place.  I am always down to try a new place that is supposedly healthy.   Wow, was I surprised.  In the first 48 hours I had eaten here for lunch, dinner and lunch again!

Walking into the place was a little daunting.  This place was so busy that there was literally a line out the door.  All the tables were filled and we were worried we'd have nowhere to sit.  This place is very hectic loud like a high school cafeteria!   The floors are nicely tiled, the tables are high end wood, as are the chairs.  There are booths along a window that, if one can grab, are pretty comfortable to sit at.

The menu consists of Breakfast items (until 11am), Soups, Salads, Pizzas, BURGERS and Wraps/Sandwiches.  Calorie Counts are next to their popular items!  To drink, there is your standard coke fountain with a dedicated dispenser for WATER.  :)

The place is very busy, but still manages to be clean.  There are no trashcans in sight, you just leave your table and the staff quickly cleans up after you.

The first time out I ordered the Ostrich Burger with Swiss Cheese and Tofu Fries.  Despite the cost of being over $15 for my order, it was delicious and I felt it was well worth it.  The burger was a tiny bit dry, but delicious nonetheless.  Burgers come with the standard lettuce, tomato and onion.  The tofu fries were unique.  I wasn't impressed at first but I later realized it was because the fries weren't cooked all the way and it was still squishy in the middle.  This meal I would rate a 8 out of 10.

Later that night I came back again and the place seemed to be less busy.  This time I ordered the Turkey Wrap with bacon and a spinach tortilla and Jicama fries (it's like eating a raw apple sliced up like fries).  Absolutely DELICIOUS!  I loved it - I was very impressed.

On to my next meal here at lunch:  This time I ordered the Bison Burger Swiss cheese, medium rare with Jicama Fries.  The burger was just the right amount of juicy absolutely incredible.   Where else can you eat a burger like this guilt free?  I also ordered a Green Leaf Berry Blast shake with almond milk.  It was very good and satisfied my cravings for fresh fruit.

Be warned, however.  Buying a shake with one of their meals is like eating two meals in one.  I was completely stuffed by the end of my visit.

Today for lunch I ordered the Turkey Burger with Swiss and half Jicama fries, half tofu fries.  To drink I got the Apple Pie Smoothie with Almond milk.  I was impressed with the burger.  Very juicy and tasty.  The Jicama fries are spot on.  Just like eating an apple again and served raw with paprika.  The Tofu fries this time however was even better than I remembered.  This is because they were actually cooked all the way through.  If I can get tofu fries prepared like this again, I think Jicama is in trouble!  On the other hand, the Apple Pie Smoothie left more to be desired. I am not a fan of this.

I am sure to visit again to try the Bison Wrap with Spinach tortilla.  My friends have all been getting it, but before I settle into my "norm" i wanted to try as much as possible here.  If my norm is the bison wrap, so be it. :) 

This place has definitely earned a solid top entry for my work lunch rotation.

I am only giving four stars for a simple reason: the guy that took my order at the register the past two times doesn't seem very friendly at all. Not a smile; not even a forced smile - it's like I'm bothering him when ordered.  On top of that, I don't EVER get a receipt from him or even offered a water cup.  The other guy, who appears to be either a manager or owner is very friendly and helpful.

Other suggestions to the owners if you are reading: You need more tables and seating - It appears the suite next to you is empty, consider expanding. :)

I really just love this place. The best part is my 9 year old daughter loves the place as well. Their egg whites out beat my made at home egg whites and the juices are AMAZING - the agave:) greens and proteins is always a fun stop after a work out with the girls:) I also love that their loyalty card is one my phone apps so I don't have to worry about losing and searching for a card in my clutter wherever it may be!
I eat here at aminimum once per week. The food is good and healthy.  I will continue to eat here

This place has roaches and I have the pictures to prove it
I've come to this location for a very long time and I like the food but lately I've seen roaches and I am no longer coming back to this location, the service is horrible also, never coming back
Awesome selection but the ketchup has high fructose corn  syrup...for the price, I expect more.  Still would highly recommend trying this place out!
Chicken breast, sweet potato, avocado after a workout.. Boom. Food is terrific as well. Get a good fresh meal for 10-15 bucks. Definitely going to be eating here too often...

Every time I come here I get great service & pay great prices. They always give me suggestions due to my cravings & they always hit it spot on! The place is always packed with people... they are definitely doing something right. I will continue to come back and be a loyal Greens & Proteins customer.

A "healthy" spot, conveniently located nearby an LVAC on the 215 and Flamingo, it provides a great place to go get some post work out food. They provide a great variety of what would be considered health foods and healthy shakes. Something I would recommend is their bison cheesesteak. It would be a favorite among anyone that tries it, and a favorite among customers. You can make your own meal, so you can try many different combinations of food and try things here that you wouldn't have otherwise. The only downside to m is the pricetag, it can be a little pricy, but this hits a specific niche of people that will spend the money to eat at a place like this. You may not enjoy the price, but you definitely will enjoy the food!

I didn't eat at this establishment but I did stop in.....check out the menu....and talk to the staff about their VEGAN options. It goes without saying they have all the usual healthy items and the prices didn't seem to bad. This particular location is right down the street from my timeshare property so I just wanted to let all my VEGAN followers they do have a healthy option in Spring Valley if they are looking for one. The establishment is very clean.....staff is friendly.....location is easy to find....and I think there is plenty on the menu for both Vegetarians and VEGANS alike.

Eat, Drink, and be Merry my Friends!!!!!

When I'm in this neck of the Summerlin woods, this is definitely my go-to in a pinch. 

The service is speedy, and the food is delish. 

Nothing fancy, but there are lots of healthy, cheap options. I had the bacon and eggs (so paleo), and the portions were pretty big. My friend had the protein pancakes. She couldn't finish them. I had a bite, and so yummy!

I really wanted to like this place.  I love to eat healthy food.  The Green Ginger Limeade was very good - no complaints about the taste, just the price.  $5.99 for a drink is too much for me.  Then I ordered the Turkey Burger wrapped in lettuce.  The presentation was nice, but it tasted terrible.  The meat was either under cooked or just had a nasty gamey taste. I tried to cover up the flavor of the meat with ketsup and mustard.  My total bill was $17.27.  Too expensive to eat food that tastes bad.

I always go to Greens and Proteins but this is my first time at this location. First there were no clean silverware. I ordered the Egg White scramble with turkey sausage. The presentation was wack and the sausage was not fully cooked it was ice cold on the inside. I let the manager or cook know and he gave me a free lunch on him on my next visit due to the inconvenience. I was cool with that.

I've been here numerous times.  For a occasional bite to eat I have no problems.  I was eating some of the build your owns. I decided to see how many calories it actually was......   You give a cup of brown rice.  Your menu states that it is 159 calories. It should be about 200.  Read a box of brown rice.  Chicken breast I weighed it at 5-6 oz cooked. Which is 6-8 raw.  That should be about 340 calories. 40-50 calories uncooked per ounce not 272.
this place is a little pricey, but everything is healthy and fresh. cant go wrong with the Wellness Drink as a post workout!

My friend and I dropped into Greens and Proteins for a post-work out second breakfast of a "healthier" fare. 

The Southwest Tofu & Chorizo Burrito caught my eye; the idea sounded interesting, and so did its description: scrambled tofu and soy chorizo, tomatoes, cilantro, and Anaheim chilies, wrapped in a spinach tortilla. A side of tofu home fries originally comes with this, but you can replace that with another side listed on their menu. Also, you can choose to sub the tortilla with lettuce. With that being said, the burrito only looks good on paper. In this case, I would've preferred actual meat than the tofu because of the spices and ingredients. 

One cool thing to mention about this place is that the calories for each of the menu items -- excluding breakfast -- are listed. Prices for foods seem reasonable, much more reasonable than other "healthy" eateries by my gym. They do make smoothies and juices here, but I think $7.50 for a smoothie is too much, even with a Yelp check-in for $1.00 off.

Came here after the gym absolutely needing something quick. I wasnt feeling well and knew I needed something but nothing on the menu really grabbed me. I decided on the watermelon raspberry "shake". It's really not a shake, more like a pulpy drink and it was really good. The place is clean, the service was quick, but I think it's pretty pricey. My shake was just about $7. This could be a place I'd frequent often but it's definitely too pricey for me. The woman ahead of me commented that they are more expensive than Whole Foods! Yikes!
Best healthy kitchen spot in Vegas!!! The service is spectacular, and the food is incredible. I'm hooked!! I'm so happy my sister recommended this juice bar to me!! :-) :-) :-)

I love the fast casual/quality food/healthy food concept. The execution can be a bit spotty and the food, while decent, won't make you forget about all the unhealthy (and more delicious) alternatives around town. The BBQ pizza was ok, but the crust was too soft and doughey. The bison cheesesteak wrap was good but I couldn't help but fantasize about biting into a real Philly cheesesteak while eating it. The girl behind the counter raved about the tofu fries but I wasn't a fan. I've never been much of a tofu fan and the fries failed to convert me.

My favorite part of their menu is the "Build your own custom meal" where you pick a protein, grain, green, and sauce of your choosing. It's perfect for when you want a quick meal, don't feel like cooking, and aren't in the mood for traditional fast food. The pork tenderloin with the balsamic reduction was good, but the portabello mushroom was overcooked. Portion sizes are on the small side so don't expect to walk away full. 

There may be some drawbacks to this place, but it's still a good option for a quick meal.

It's hard to eat healthy when you are one the road for work, so imagine my surprise when I found Greens and Proteins!

This place is an anomoly in Vegas, where the level of obesity rivals any in America.  It is full of Vegan hipsters,granola munching anti-gluteners, and fitness junkies.  I felt like I had been transported to Santa Cruz or Berkeley!

I ordered a chicken parmagian from their daily specials - it was created with a leaning towards Paleo: spaghetti squash topped with chicken breast and covered in a marinara and (this parts not Paleo) cheeses.   It came with a side dish of cooked fresh spinach, which I topped with a basalmic reduction.  The spaghetti squash was well drained and cooked perfectly - when I make it at home, it's squishy and unevenly cooked!  The marinara had a nice fresh flavor and the cheeses were melted in goey goodness.  The spinach was plain so I requested a vinegar to top it with - the friendly and creative 'waiter' suggested the basalmic.

The service was friendly and helpful - I'm definitely coming back when I am in Las Vegas.

Had the protein pancakes.  Pretty good. Asked for the healthiest drink they and was told the "wellness". Everything was really good.   Service was great. Sure tasted mighty good for s healthy drink.  Wifey got the watermelon strawberry cocktail. That was just as good. Good clean location.  Close to home.  I can't wait to come back for the ostrich burgers and bison burgers.  Prices are decent.  Service is great.  They give you free "lime cucumber water to drink".  Top notch baby!!!

This place is perfect after a good workout...Today was actually my second time here. The first time I had the buffalo chicken wrap and it was ok. And tonight  I had the bbq pizza and it was sooooooo good !! Service is always great...  I will definitely be back!

Greens & Proteins is amazing, hands down. It's the only place I go when I'm looking for a bite to eat and want to eat healthy. So many places have tried the health conscious menu and the end result is flavorless food (Lyfe Kitchen) but everything I've had here is delicious. The bison wrap w/ tofu fries is my favorite. Highly recommended.
Great attitude of employees.  Great service.  FABULOUS greens drink.  Made the best way .. In a vitamix.  Great choice!!

Very healthy! They have all fresh organic breakfast and lunch items, hours mon-sun 7a-10p. A variety of raw juices. What I love about the menu is that you're able to customize your meal. i.e choose your protein, greens, grains and sauce. Have I mentioned it's healthy?!!! Yum

OMG wow! This place was so amazing! I'm not even the type of girl that enjoys eating healthy but this place actually was not that bad. I'm not even a big fan of Tofu yet I was munching on Tofu fries and let's not even get me started on how freaking bomb the barbecue pizza was... Like man oh man, I think I might need another Greens and Proteins fix again this week

Loved this place. Open spacious awesome decor. Large menu for paleo, raw GF DF and meat hedonists alike. I had the grilled vegetables burger on GF bread with jicama fries.
My eating companion has a big bison cheese burger and was happy. I'd come back many times if I loved here. The caffeinated smoothies looked off the hook! 
Please come to the Bag Area!!

I love this place! I go to this location more than the other and it is a little nicer/quieter (but both are great.) 

The option for Pea Protein in smoothies is great for those of us who don't want Whey and don't use Soy (not all that common to have this option for a smoothie.)

The raw menu is amazing - try it all, seriously.

There is something on the breakfast menu with egg whites and turkey sausage that is so clean, healthy, delicious, and filling - not a very common combination (for under $10 to boot :P )

I had the Green Smoothie and it was so delicious! They allowed us to call ahead to place the order (they take a long time to make your order normally). We arrived, paid and left with our drinks. Clean place, everyone is friendly and educated on what you order. I have also had the build your own meal and that is very good. I had Tuna -steak with Quinoa and broccoli it came with a lemon sauce on the side (there are more options).
I strongly recommend this place to my friends and family. They get so busy sometimes, so if you are in a hurry i advise to call ahead to place your order.
A little pricey, but you get what you pay for. The food is delicious as well as the smoothies. It was my first time eating here and I am a fan.
I love this place. The turkey breast is the best! Perfect right after a workout. Portions could stand to be a little bigger but food is clean and amazing.

Whenever I'm on the west side of town, I hit up this location for my healthy eats. I'd give 4.5 stars for this location, the missing 1/2 star is because I like the decor of the Eastern & 215 location more (lovely little waterfalls and live plants inside).

But have no fear, the Flamingo & 215 location has got what you need for tasty food and great service. My most recent visit was ordering food to go, and the staff knows how to make you feel welcome. Even though they're steady-busy with business, my cashier was polite and engaging. The food runner was just as good, it's nice to be treated well even if you're grabbing food to go. Thanks!

I came here last night for dinner, and I also have come here dozens of times before and am always satisfied. I often order take out, and they are always quick to answer the phone and prepare my order. This is a great place to eat in as well since there are always open tables (inside and outside on the patio), and I do really like their complementary cucumber water for eating in. 

I come here when I am looking for a macro-friendly healthy and delicious meal. I love the Bison Burger, Chicken Sausage Pizza, BBQ Chicken Pizza, and Chicken Cheese Steak (with lettuce wrap) since these are all filling, healthy (lower calorie), and tasty options. For their sides, I love their tofu fries and their buffalo chicken strips. I also love to get steamed broccoli or asparagus with their reduced balsamic vinaigrette (so yummy!)

For dessert, I'd recommend the granola crusted whole wheat french toast since it's tasty, relatively healthy and not overly sweet. 

Sometimes, the menu can be confusing with macro/calorie counting especially with the different options for wraps/burgers, etc (lettuce wrap, whole wheat bun, etc.) I would also like if they showed the macros for the sides as well such as for the jicama fries, sweet potato fries. I haven't had their smoothies, but watch out since they tend to be on the more caloric side. 

This place is great and a "go to" if you are looking for a healthy, guilt-free meal that still hits the spot.

So far, so good! Excellent service & excellent food. This was my second visit and had an acai bowl for the first time ever, that made me think....why have I never tried this before! It was so yummy! I had the breakfast burrito the last time and that was amazing also.

Great place to load up on protein or eat clean. It is pricey for the portion you get but their offerings are one of a kind! They offer bison, ostrich, your traditional chicken, and tofu. This is my second time at g&p but my first at this location. Its super hip and it's also a great place for your lunch break or catch up on work. 

I ordered their bison cheese steak on a spinach wrap which is about 600+ calories for $10.99. It also comes with their yummy tofu fries and dipping sauce! The cheese steak is delish and the bison is super lean. Bison is just naturally full in flavor so if you're looking for a good manly meat that's lean but tastes like cow (mmoooo) go bison! I also ordered their white chocolate veggiechino which is 500+ calories for $6.99. I chose the almond milk (you can choose the option of soy or Almond milk) it was pretty delish with grains of grinded up coffee bean. If you're looking for a big caffeine kick I would not bet that the veggiechino will be a good pick me up especially if you're a coffee drinker. But as a sweet milky treat. I think it's a good choice. 

My meal summed up to $20 for myself. It is a bit pricey but if it's just one of those clean eating going out to lunch days I say go for it but I would only drop in occasionally if I'm in the mood. I just think their price does equal the value in portion for me.

Greens and Protein is a healthy lifestyle themed cafe that I enjoy. They do a solid job at serving up tasty treats that focus on packing a punch with calories and nutrition. Healthy + Nutritious + Yummy = A happy and fulfilling power lunch. 

Come here if you're...

A) health conscious  
B) trying to stay on track with your lofty dietary goals 
C) want to try a spot that is all about getting Greens & Proteins into your hungry belly.

G&P offers a variety of options to choose from. They offer-- small pickings (appetizers), soups, salads, pizzas, burgers, wraps/sandwiches, 'raw' options, smoothies, and juice. 

Things I've sampled and enjoyed included..... 

Crab and Avocado Lettuce Cups- Bibb Lettuce, Radicchio Cups, Crab and Avocado (they had me at crab and avocado...love at first bite)

Hummus and Pita- Artichoke and Roasted Red Pepper Hummus with Pita bread for dipping (solid appetizer or main meal.. you choose)

Tofu Banana Split Smoothie- Carrots, Banana, Strawberries, Tofu, Peaches, Pecans, Vanilla, Agave Nectar, Almond Milk, Yellow Squash, and Ice (I have them leave the agave out..  you can keep it in if you want to mask the veggie taste..)

Bison Burger- Cheese, Lettuce, tomato and onion w/ tofu fries (This was my co-workers order. He gobbled it down and gave it 2 thumbs up)

Tofu Fries - Tofu sticks that are baked and adorned with a paprika spice that are also served with some sort of dipping sauce (I sampled off my co-workers plate.. yeah, we share like that..)

This place is all about providing you with a nutritionally sound bites that delight. Come here if you're watching the scale or trying to eat clean.

After the gym I am starving and in need of some refreshments. Greens and Proteins has a great menu for the healthy bunch of us out there looking for clean food. I leave full but not heavy, and def recommend the bison burger...it was fantastic!

On a recent visit to the strip we decided to travel off the strip about 10 minutes west.  Very good selection of foods and drinks; the salad was large and the chicken was juicy.  I also tried the "green drink" and this is a good meal replacement complete with fruits and vegetables.  We liked it so much that we went back for breakfast and the multi grain cakes were good but the french toast w/ agavi syrup was excellent and both for $15.00  Lastly don't forget the "free" cucumber water.  Can't wait for locations in So Cal.

Been to the G & P on eastern also by the lvac. Came to this one last week to give it a try. The shopping center that its located in is practically dead. the only thing opened next to G & P is a tanning salon and a zabas, everything is closed or empty. 

Upon entering you can see the inside is actually really nice. I think it actually looks better than the one on eastern. The menu is pretty clear and precise. It ranges from green juices, green smoothies and then your food items. All the food items i would say are healthy, you can even get gluten free items or protein style for your burgers if you want.

I ordered from the create your own menu. Basically you pick a protein, 1 side and a grain and your choice of sauce. I picked bison patty for my protein and sauteed spinach, and grilled onions for my sides instead of getting a grain. I also ordered a wellness drink.

The bison patty was cooked as ordered it didn't strike me as anything amazing. It was kind of bland and dry. I'm assuming it was bland because it was healthier. The spinach and the onions tasted exactly as they should nothing special but was expected. The wellness drink was actually my favorite of all the items ordered it tasted really good for all the green vegetables in it. It was actually really sweet so i think they probably put more juice in it to mask the vegetable taste.

Overall place isn't bad but nothing special. One thing I must warn you about is, it is extremely overpriced! Looking at the prices i was surprised they charged so much for vegetables you can buy and make a whole weeks worth for the price the same price. 

Side note: there are also a lot of jacked up guys and girls in yoga pants that stop in because the LVAC is right next to it. So if you want to sit in and people watch it is a good place to do that.

The staff was very friendly and they are the reason I will return. There was an allergy issue and the staff handled it very well. They were kind and kept apologizing but it really was our fault for not reading all of the ingredients closely to see one was an allergen. 

The prices are pretty high but this is a health menu restaurant. The indoor sitting area seemed uncomfortable and multiple two seated tables. The outdoors seating was beautiful and welcoming. It was a beautiful day so that just added to the attraction.

The plates arrived with a large serving of food and the dishes were tasty. It was not a place for a wow factor but great service. I enjoyed the Chicken Quinoa salad and my friend had the Fresh Fruit salad.

This place is a bit pricey but it's really a great place for some pre or post workout meals and smoothies. Almost everyone who was here was in work out clothes haha. 

I tried the Margherita pizza and the Green Leaf Berry Blast. 

The Margherita pizza was simple but delicious. It was a thin crust pizza with tomato sauce, low-fat mozzarella cheese and slices of tomato with bits of basil garnishing. I wish I had gotten the gluten free version though! - I really love how they have the gluten free option. The portion was probably good for sharing with one other person. 

The smoothie was alright. The taste was leaning more towards the spinach and kale which I wasn't really fond of. I do love kale though but it was probably the spinach that was giving it a weird flavor. I'd give it a 3/5. 

There was also complimentary cucumber water which was a refreshing touch. The place itself is pretty spacious and busy but the service was fast and the workers were very nice. I'm glad that this place is close by my neighborhood. I will definitely stop by again to try the other foods. They also have an ostrich burger which I don't think I'll be trying anytime soon lol.
I am coming here after my work out. Delicious , healthy and affordable. Very nice and kind personal. Five star!

Wow! Loved the food & service!! I finally tried G&P with a friend. She ordered me the Bison cheese steak in spinach wrap with tofu fries. Not a fan of tofu, but I was trusting her... 
She was so right! The wrap & tofu fries were unbelievably delicious!! And the owner, Patrick even comes around to deliver food to the tables as well check on customers. The whole staff was great! I will definitely be coming back & can't wait for the North location to open!

We came here this morning for some smoothies and went for the Chocolate veggiechino and the Green Shake. I was afraid the chocolate smoothie would be too dense and heavy but how wrong I was. It was light, moreish and delicious!! It was actually my partners drink but I tried to claim it for myself. All the flavours were distinguishable and it was a great little caffeine booster after a hard gym class. I also loved the coffee bean/ chocolate bits in there. The green shake was also really tasty, however I thought it'd be more fruity than leafy.
They are quite pricey but competitive when you think about other places and a good size. Plus it's pretty much a meal as it keeps you full for ages and $6-7 for a meal is not bad at all! 
Customer service was great and the ladies were chatty and friendly. Will definitely return for my new favourite smoothie!

I've never ordered food, only juices and smoothies. Just recently tried the Veggiechino - full of proteins and green. Kept me full all day.  Fresh and delicious! Employees are friendly, the place is immaculate.

Awesome pick up service of excellent food. We called in our order and when we showed up the ladies labeled each meal with the name of the person who ordered it. Our customers really loved that. Delivered by www.postmates.com. We deliver from the restaurants you want to your home or office.

I had the low carb salad with chicken.  The serving of the small chicken was 6oz which was great.  The dressing tasted fantastic, but there wasn't much of salad in a half order.  The cashier made me think it would have been bigger.  I ended up taking a slice of my bf's buffalo chicken pizza. OMG it was really good - and i'm not saying that just because i'm carb depleted.  The toppings were very good and had a nice sweet tangy zip.  My kids enjoyed cheese pizza and pasta, but i was confused that the kids size pizza was the same size as my boyfriends full size pizza.  I don't get that.  In the end, i really enjoyed dining here.  It would be great to see one of these restaurants open in the N. Phoenix, AZ area where I live!

I am a healthy eater. Annoyingly healthier eater. Eating out has been know to be frustrating since my husband and I have different tastes and appetite sizes.  

Greens and Proteins is a perfect fit for our family. Good quality ingredients that appeal to both the herbivore and the carnivore and our son who is in the middle. 

My husband has the BBQ chicken pizza and loved it. Plenty of food to fill full without feeling stuffed. I have the veggie sandwich and cleaned my plate. 

Great service. Great food. Comfortable casual dinning experience. This will be a regular lunch spot for us.
One of my favorite places in Vegas. Great selection of healthy food choices for all three meals. Highly recommend this spot!

I'm obsessed with this place. The employees are SO NICE. They provide the nutrition info for all their food. I ordered a new item, the Ahi Protein Salad, and the chef stopped by my table to get feedback on it. Because it was new. LOVE THAT. My previous favorite was the Summer Berry Salad. Now I have a sweet option and a savory option. I feel like the restaurant is run professionally, they clean up tables the moment people get up, the food is yummy and healthy. What more could you want?

Amazing customer service! 

I did not ask the name of the lady at the register but she was very sweet and carried on a light conversation while taking my order, which I always appreciate! 

My antioxidant chiller tasted yummy and is one of my favorite things to get at Greens and Proteins! 

I always stop by here when I'm looking for a healthy snack and will definitely keep coming back!

Love this place!! I'm new to the area and was invited by friends and thought why not! The menu has a wide variety including vegan items- I am not vegan but for some reason decided to order from the "vegan side" of the menu. The chicken lettuce cups were delicious!! Service was fast, friendly staff and kick ass cucumber water that's freeeeee! The banana split smoothie is the jam by the way. So happy I found a healthy place so close to me! Worth saying again that the staff was really nice and they all had smiles on their faces!

Super friendly staff on top of fresh and clean dine in plus delicious good for you eats. Food is great Only beef is my juice had stems in it a few times I've ordered which isn't the easiest thing when trying to drink from a straw. Surprise haha. None the less I'll keep eating here happily.
Great tasting juice! This location is a little trendy with all the gym people but overall the juice is great and the staff is nice.

I finished up a doctors appointment in the area and wanted a meal or a snack. Greens and Proteins popped up as having a $1 off juice special, so I stopped by to see what the place was all about.

The place was one of the healthiest "fast food" restaurants I've seen, and the prices were pretty damn affordable for what you get. I decided to skip the juice and get a pick your own meal with ahi tuna, sauted kale, and brown rice, with a spicy peanut sauce. It was all delicious and felt really healthily prepared.

Even better, the guy taking my order was super friendly and took my Yelp checkin offer. He ended up getting tipped, so it probably cost me more to use it lol. All in, the meal was around $13-$14 and was well worth it. I hope this place adds more locations, because I'm rarely that far away from the strip.

It was just ok. I believe I expected too much. I ordered the carrot juice without the stevia and it tasted extremely thick. I had to have it blended again and it still wasn't the consistency of juice. I guess I was looking for that juice effect...but didn't get it. I ordered the vegan southwest burrito, which was just ok. Nothing to call home about. With it being so many places in this area with the same concept, im sure to try some of them. It wasn't awful, just not what I expected.

During my bike ride Sunday, I stopped at Greens and Proteins for breakfast.  Who would have thought that healthy food would taste as good as this did?  I was surprised.

The place was almost empty and after ordering my Greek Scramble and coffee, I took a seat at a table under the section near the entrance that has a roof overhead.  The young lady who took my order, gave me a post with a number so she'd know where the food was to be delivered.  She soon brought my coffee which was very hot and enjoyable.

The Greek scramble consisted of scrambled egg whites with feta cheese, kalamata olives, basil, green peppers, onions, and was accompanied by tofu home fries.  Their information lists this at 309 calories.  I wasn't concerned so much about that as I was taste.

The taste was quite good.  The olives brought out the flavor of the feta and the tofu home fries were a treat.  There were some pieces of toasted pita to accompany the scramble.

I will stop in again and try something else.  The price was very reasonable and the patio dining was perfect before the hot days set in.

One note for those who ride a bicycle--few I know--there is a garbage can on the east side of the building and you can lock your bike to that with your cable.

YUMMMY! I got the bison cheese steak wrap and my friend had the California chicken wrap , we split them both ! Quick and fast after the gym. Food was fresh as well. The bison was a little salty but it could of been the chef hehhe !
I love the Bison wrap.  The jicama fries are okay; I like mine with a little honey or barbeque sauce.

I'm pushing it with the 3 Stars, but my husband liked his food so I'll be kind. This is the 2nd time we come here and both times I've been underwhelmed and disappointed with my food. The first time I ordered a grilled chicken teriyaki wrap and the chicken was practically burnt and there was no teriyaki sauce. I had to ask for extra to put it on myself. This time I ordered the summer berry salad with chicken and it was drowning in dressing and had like 5 berries with undercooked chewy chicken. My fountain drink was good though. This place is overrated BIG TIME.!!
Food was good I love ahi taco yummy and the drink ! Near to the house ! If you are looking for healthy food ! I definitely coming back:)

You'll get fresh healthy food, but expect to pay a price for it.

Stopped in for a quick healthy lunch, was greeted with friendly service and paid $35 for two to eat.  The green leaf berry smoothie was good, but the apple pie smoothie tasted watered down.  Next the Margherita Pizza (about 10" across / enough for 2 people to eat) was just like any other you can get and the Thai Chicken Peanut Satays sounded appealing.  They were supposed to be spicy, but were not at all; they were chicken skewers with some kind of creamy peanut sauce over them.  

Nice atmosphere - guilt free eating - just wish it was more affordable.

Wow...A new location and all reviews are 5 Stars.  Albeit only 3 reviews, this is a new location on the Westside (i.e. the best side, throwing up the W!!).  If you read my review of the Eastern location, I too gave them 5 stars.  However, it's easy to dismiss these posts as biased ones since there is so little reviews.  I had to investigate because that's what I do.   

I am a fan of Greens & Proteins and one complaint about them is price.  Most of the items on the menu are pricey and to be honest, don't have much taste either.  Keep in mind, G&P is healthy and that includes you to have an healthy wallet. I'm not a baller by any means, but will splurge when quality proteins is what my body needs.  I also use to have food delivered to my home via "Eat to Grow".  This was pricey too and taste is only for the desirable.  I made my biggest gains on these meals and G&P is no different. 

I've tried their Salmon and Ostrich Burgers in the past.  At this location, I opted to try their Turkey.  You get 8 oz of clean protein and less fat with their Turkey Burger.  This meal is also served with their Jicama fries.  The turkey was pretty good, but the fries is something that made it into the basura with the quickness. After Lent, I will definitely come back for their Filet Mignon.  

I gave the other location 5 stars, but had to drop this location to 4 stars.  This G&P is more spacious, but missing that ambiance that the Eastern location has. Great people watching at the Eastern location.  Because this location is new, the staff is also new.  Knowledge is power and a newbie staff can mean weakness.  When I order at places like this, I like to know how much the servings are like protein count, total ounces, etc.  The staff actually had to go to the back and ask.  They also didn't know if they served fat-free ranch.  I know, I'm just getting picky but these are the things most health driven restaurants would know.  I'm sure by the next visit, they'll be more prepared. Thus, I will probably up their rating back to 5 stars. 

Still a fan of Greens and Protein.  Don't be surprised if you see multiple check in's from me at this joint.  This is a new and more spacious location.  I'm sure within the next couple of months, the word will be out and the ambiance will mimic what the Eastern location provides.

Decided to stop in here after finishing my leg workout at LVAC. I usually hit Tropical Smoothie but had been meaning to stop by this place. I needed something to go so I figured I would try one of the smoothies; they all seemed tempting. I settled on the Green Smoothie. I was pleasantly surprised when I took my first taste. I have to say I'll be back and next time try some of the food.

I ate the French toast which contained pecans which isn't mentioned in the online, on-screen (in store), or the paper menu. I had an allergic reaction to the pecans which I would have avoided had I known the allergen information. I didn't bother mentioning anything to employees since we needed to leave to deal with my reaction before it got worse. What kind of food provider doesn't list allergen information? 

Otherwise, the food tasted reasonably ok. We would have perhaps returned as we're trying to create healthier eating habits and also enjoy trying new things. The service was mediocre and the beverage selection was oddly limited. We obviously won't return due to the allergy issue.

I raised my rating to 3 stars because the owner wrote me a thoughtful apology.

That said, I will still avoid this Flamingo/215 Greens&Proteins location because the food quality and the consistency of food preparation is very disappointing. Rainbow/215 and Eastern/215 don't have the same issue. It's too bad because the outdoor patio at Flamingo is the nicest!

I'm on the HCG diet & dare not eat out & risk ruining my strict protocol, but I'd heard about this place & the HCG menu, so I had to try it.  It's in a cool area with lots of fitness/health type shops, and it was positively buzzing with the weekday lunch crowd; obviously a fave for the health conscious professionals.  The HCG menu is simple; choose a protein & a veggie, they do the rest.  No measuring or worrying about how to prepare while sticking to the diet plan, they have it all figured out for me.  I ordered mine to go, shrimp & asparagus; it took about 15 minutes, and a guy brought it to my table. I had to take a peek once I made it to the car; wow!  Jumbo shrimp & skinny asparagus, both tender & perfectly cooked, served in a reusable plastic container with a side of dijon mustard.  Delicious!  What a treat to get to have a meal out & know it's structured around my diet; LOVED IT!!

Love the chocolate peanut butter banana smoothie! I tried the buffalo chicken tenders today and was disappointed with how "zesty" it was. I would recommend less citrus as that was the only thing keeping me from enjoying the meal. I loved that it was under 450 calories as well as a nice presentation.

I made my own meal: grilled chicken, spaghetti squash and quinoa. I really liked that you could look at each item on the menu and see how many calories and grams of protein there were. I liked everything, though I could tell I was eating healthy food( bland). But when you are trying to eat clean and feel full. They did a very good job. (11.99$ for my meal)

I'm super disappointed with my experience with this business. I placed an online order using this app a few days ago when I visited Vegas. First of all, they called me and told me that the soup I ordered was not available due to a broken blender and politely offered a turkey chili, which seemed fine, until he said it would cost me an additional $2. No thank you, I kindly responded. He offered to deliver the parfaits I ordered and claimed he would give me a credit for the soup, which seemed great. Until I checked my bank account. At first, I figured maybe the double charge was accidentally, until it fully posted to my bank account. I contacted the bank and they claim they are both legitimate charges. So let me break it down for everyone- my first charge (soup included) was 23.58, the second was for 17.62. I literally was charged $41 for two little parfaits.

I remember my first visit at Greens & Protein on Eastern & Pebble and I gotta say it was the worst experience ever. Fortunately for me things have improved and I do realize that each location varies. 

I've been to this particular location twice now on a Saturday and Monday and I'm very pleased so far. I've been ordering their egg white scramble turkey breakfast and a green chia seed smoothie with added protein and I must say that it's pretty darn amazing.

I love eating at a place where I am aware of the ingredients are in my food and where they give a precise calories count of each dish. It definitely makes life easier for me.

I also love that this healthy place doesn't cost an arm and a leg for super delicious and fresh food. This has become my favorite place to eat breakfast and I highly recommend it to anyone who loves to eat healthy.

Way to go G&P!!!

I was not impressed with my juice at all. When I order juice I expected it to be juice. I received my drink and as I was drinking it I noticed something was weird. I asked the guy at the counter what type of juicer they used because I've never had such a Texture before... He informed me that they do not use juicers at all but they blend their juices... Then that is not considered a juice! That is a blended vegetable drink. If I wasn't with my coworkers I would have asked for a full refund because I was not even able to drink it. I am on a strict juice diet and cannot have much fiber and that was definitely not in the description. Plus you would think being a healthy alternative restaurant they would know that blending vegetables ruins the nutrient value. 

You would think when somebody advertises juices that it would be juice not blended and chunky ( gross) 

Waste of my time and money! Ended up skipping lunch that day because I couldn't finish the "juice" without gagging and didn't have time to go anywhere else. 

I am giving it a two star because inside was clean, nice, and customer service was great! Everybody who got food there said it was a bit overpriced, which I agree.  

That was definitely the worst juice I have ever had in my life. That was my first time there and definitely will not come back.

Greens and Proteins: The name says it all! 

I make a smoothie daily and regularly visit smoothie and juice bars, but I've never had a smoothie as good as the ones that my husband and I tried here. The consistency was so smooth yet thick like any good smoothie should be. 

There are SO many good options here for anyone. Make sure to get the potato melody as your side! : )
Best juices in town! I I am addicted to the wellness and antioxidant juice. Nice clean location as well.... Oh yeah can't forget about the turkey burgers!

The fact that I can eat an ENTIRE Gluten Free pizza and KNOW the Macros is amazing in itself. The fact that the macros are SO GOOD that I can EASILY fit it in my day even on contest prep is even better!!!! Everything I have had has been AMAZING .. but the fact that they list ALL Macros is what keeps me going back! Thank you for providing this service .. especially for those of us that practice Flexible Dieting! You make dining out easy! Makes me not want to go anywhere else when I want to "eat out" :)

Not bad, food is pretty good, the drinks are different and definitely awesome to tryout. 

When I came I had a turkey burger with tofu fries, taste pretty good.

Not just for health freaks people I'm telling you! I'm not a hardcore vegan or health nut but I do pay attention to what's going in my body so I had to give this place a try. I had the steak tacos. Delicious! I don't know what kind of sauce they put on top but it made the tacos!! You got 3 tacos with the choice of corn tortillas or lettuce wrapped. Large portion only really needed to eat 2. I'll definitely be in again and again. Craving one of their delicious fresh smoothies! Also, the establishment itself looks SO clean. That is not something I ever overlook. They do have a pretty large selection in food and drinks as well. Go try it!

Strictly service. I love the food and drinks here! Very tastey and healthy! What I'm not happy with today is service. The counter girl, short tanned brunette has a really bad attitude about her. I felt like I was annoying her by ordering and that I was an inconvenience to her when I was asking her questions trying to figure out which shake I used to love to order. Wednesday morning 10:15 girl, work on your attitude.
Waited for ever for my food they got my simple salad wrong the ahi tuna salad was terrible customer service sucks won't be back

I love this kind of place. Everything is kept clean and the drinks are always prepared fresh. It's easy to eat healthy here. They have great selection for any craving you have. I love the complimentary cucumber citrus water. They lose a star because of their pricing.

Meh. I came here entry because I had to be somewhere super early and didn't have anything at home to make breakfast. I had briefly looked over their menu and was interested in trying a juice and the Acai bowl. Once I got there I realized that I was more hungry than I thought so I decided to order their breakfast burrito, the Acai bowl and the watermelon and strawberry juice smoothie. The total was like 18 bucks, damn! Anyway, the juice was fine. The burrito had no flavor whatsoever. They give you a little salsa on the side to spice it up, but even that was not sufficient. Eggs just need butter and salt, and this contained none of that. The acai bowl was good, and I have been back about three times to order it again. Others the that, it really is expensive and not as flavorful as I would have liked.

Stopped by today for the first time . I had the Chocolate Veggiechino.  It was delicious. I love that they use all natural ingredients. I would suggest this Cafe to anyone looking for a healthy alternative.

My daughter & I came here after workout and ordered 2 Wellness drinks (green grapes, green apple, pineapple, orange, lime, wheat grass, kale, spinach, collard greens, ginger, flax seed & agave) --- so good & refreshing. 

Loaded antioxidant chiller (green grapes, blueberries, blackberries, agave nectar) ordered by my daughter's friends - tastes like grape, delicious, not very sweet which is good. 
Location is convenient. Will come back definitely. Just found out have loyalty cards -- buy 10 smoothies get the 11th free. A dollar off if you check in with yelp. Not a bad deal :)

Love the veggie burger and tofu fries. Food is amazing and they even give free green water which is all that I drink. The manager Patrick has been super helpful and they recently catered an open house for me. I love this place. 5 Stars!
So delicious! I drove past this place a few times after the gym, and finally stopped in today. I had the G&P veggie burger with jicama fries and wow! I scarffed it down quick. Yum :))
Slow service. I was in front of the line and made me wait about 7 mins. Love their juices but its a bit overpriced.

I looooove the loaded antioxidant chiller juice! It's my absolute faaav one! I also love the get the tofu fries and the summer berry salad with shrimp! Overall, I recommend! & the cashier is such a cutie with big blue eyes (:
best smoothie I have ever had, chocolate peanut butterr.... I died.

The people behind the counter greeted us immediately when we entered. The food was delicious and made in a timely manner. Gluten friendly food available. You can get your food to go or have a dine in experience.

Because of the nearby LVAC, this place has kinda become the a mecca of yoga pants and "arms day" guys. So, if you can put up with the constant influx of that crowd, you're good to eat here. I'm actually shocked what some people are wearing to the gym these days...anyway...

I come here for the smoothies, not the food. I have always found the food here to be really bland and overpriced. The gluten-free bread is terrible. Don't bother freaking out over it. Their tofu fries are AMAZING. I love love love these. They are pretty much the only thing I will order as far as solid food goes. Buffalo sauce is very tasty as well and they have a nice vegan alternative that comes with these if you ask.

I really do love the smoothies. I've been coming here for a few years now, and their smoothies never get old. They are super refreshing, healthy, and I really do think it's a reasonable price compared to Whole Foods (not to mention they taste way better). 

This location does have a nice outside seating area (complete with umbrellas), which I do enjoy in the summer.

I came here with my brother just to have a little snack a while ago. I ordered the chicken strips to have something in my stomach. The chicken was really dry and I did not enjoy it very well. But my brother got this juicy burger (idk the name of it). He also got a side of tofu fries. The tofu fries are DELICIOUS. I crave it so much. It's a must!!! The prices are a reasonable price. It is supposed to be a healthy place so it's going to cost a bit.

Wow! I was in town and wanted a healthy meal. I came here based on the reviews. I was not disappointed. The salmon was super fresh and delicious and the salad was amazing. I ordered the lemon vinaigrette on the side and it was tasty.

Sometimes after a healthy meal I am hungry quick. This meal had enough spice and seasoning to make me feel full longer.

Green and Proteins has great, ridiculously healthy food. For real - I didn't know it was possible to make some of the things they offer in such low calorie ways. I've tried a few different juices and a few different food items, and it's all been great. I'd eat here all the time if it wasn't so expensive (for me, personally). To get a fancy drink and a meal will cost you about $12-15, which is middle-ground pricing around the city, but I consider coming here more of a splurge. The two locations are each far from the heart of Vegas, but it's worth stopping in if you're in the neighborhood!

The points are for the effort. Otherwise, bland, overpriced and misleading. They blend their 'juices' and put sweetener in everything. Pretty gross. The 'veggie parm' is just spaghetti squash (instead of noodles), marinara and cheese (vegan available), no veggies at all, for $9. The 'make your own meal' thing is bland and comes with a tiny container of sauce. We gave them a couple tries because they were the only vegetarian place around where we stayed, but next time we'll just drive further or order veggie options from a thai place or something.

When I wrote my initial review all I had had here were the smoothies and they were a little sweet for my taste. However, after trying the food this is like hella my new favorite place to eat. 

The service is awesome, the place is always clean, the food is IN. SANE. and really reasonably priced. Honestly this place rocks. Breakfast served all day and the caloric value of each item is stated on the menu. 

For realz, if you are looking for a delicious, healthy, and quick meal at any time of day I definitely recommend this joint.
Want a healthy lunch but not a boring one? This place is it! And their sweet potato fries are great!
I can't get enough of this place.  They have the best selection of healthy food and I've never been disappointed with my choices; always fresh and prepared daily.

I came here for a lunch meeting with one of the offices that we work a lot with and at first I was very hesitant as I have never heard of this place. What a great choice to go to for the health conscious eater.  I ordered the peanut chicken skewers and the G&P salad. The portions are big, enough for two people.   The staff were really friendly.  Prices very reasonable.  Although it's a bit far from work, I will definitely visit this place again.

I've eaten here a couple of times and I'm happy to see healthier options popping up around the Las Vegas Valley. I like coming here when I'm craving for burgers because they have Bison meat which tastes great! I've also had their Philly Cheesesteak as well which is equally delicious. The last time I was here I had their flatbread pizza it was pretty tasty. 

I do love this concept but I wish they would give you a choice of a side salad instead of Jicama strips. I only like Jicama with hot sauce and vinegar. I also wish they would blend their drinks a little better. I ordered a green drink and a peeling or something got stuck in my throat.  It wasn't pleasant but before that the drink was good! I'm sure this was just a freak accident.
